In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
BPW Partner Page     
Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Eddy Mercedes

texts.es:
Eddy tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Eddy desea ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido, para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Eddy is 19 years old, is single and lives with her parents in the Mochumí district, a commercial farming area that belongs to the Lambayeque province found more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She is dedicated to selling catalog cosmetics. She sells those products among neighbors and friends. On a daily basis, she works to gain more customers since the more orders made from the company providing products, the greater her income. The business helps her to meet her personal expenses and to support her parents with economic support for the home.

Eddy wishes to expand her business by installing a shop for cosmetic products in her home. This way, her customers will have products at hand and will not have to wait until the end of the month when their orders arrive. For this, she needs more products and to achieve her objective, she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,000 "soles" from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand her business.

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en:
Ramla is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a firewood sales business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she sells fresh water which contributes another source of income. Ramla faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to become a big supplier of firewood in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Irene Gardenia

texts.es:
Irene Gardenia C. O. tiene 45 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre vive con los padres y con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Irene Gardenia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta viajar.
texts.en:
Irene Gardenia C. O. is 45 years old.  She has a common-law husband and lives with her parents and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 6 children.

The members of the UNION SAN ANTONIO community bank are located in San Antonio precinct, in San José del Tambo parish, 150 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this business for many years.

Irene Gardenia is a farmer who grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  She buys her products in Matilde Esther shopping area and sells her products in Bucay.

Irene Gardenia is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a house.  She likes to travel.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Leofe

texts.en:
Leofe B. is from the village of Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 32 years old. Leofe is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of manufacturing and selling lampakanay products to local businesses and community members. (Editor's note: Twisted fibers from the lampakanay aquatic herb are twisted and woven, and are used to make baskets and to cover chairs, etc.). Leofe is just starting this business.

In 2008, Leofe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. 

Leofe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Margos Kapatagan, Aurora Zamboang Del Sur

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila S., 48, is from the village of Turod. She is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonila raises livestock, primarily pigs for fattening and sale.  Leonila has been in business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a months.

In 2011, Leonila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is 67 years old, married, and has 8 children and 22 grandchildren. She is a member of the communal bank "Solidaridad". She will be using her loan of 3000 nuevos soles to purchase animals at markets outsiD. of Ayacucho. She butchers them for meat in her home with the help of some of her children, and sells the meat to local stores and restaurants to earn income. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 20 years now and enjoys being able to work and save.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Meriden

texts.en:
Meriden is a married woman who lives in Candoni, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating four business ventures: buying and selling rice, buying & selling charcoal, a general store and a farming business. Her husband Rolando, who is 52 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are between 20 and 30 years old. Meriden joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Meriden has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her child’s education. Meriden is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Kasur, a small city in Pakistan known for its leather industry. She has lived with her family in the area of Bhutta sohan din in a 3-room brick house for the past 10 years. 

Khalida is 35 years old and has 4 daughters. Her 2 elder daughters are enrolled in a school and getting their education, while her younger daughters are not yet of school age.  Her husband operates a power loom machine and prepares bedsheets. His bedsheets are in high demand because he is very good at his work and produces quality work with good designs. 

Khalida also supports her husband by making bedsheets. She is very skillful and helps her husband in fulfilling larger orders on time. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy thread in larger quantitues to make more bedsheets to sell and to earn better profits. Khalida is hopeful that an investment will bring her husband’s business to a better position and he will be able to make more money than before.

loans.use: to buy thread for bedsheet making business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. is currently in the business of selling alcohol. 

She is 28 years old and married, with six children. Four of them go to school. 

A. borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. She hopes to expand her business and buy land with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio M. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 60 years old. Florencio is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a tricycle transport service. Florencio has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $238 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florencio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

Florencio is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be his 2nd loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Miriam Mercedes

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Valroc. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 12 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en Universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Tiene un bazar en su casa en el cual además de vender artículos de bazar también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y zapatos aunque esto en menor cantidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00. Sus productos los va a comprar a Guayaquil cuando necesita surtir su negocio y también recibe mercadería en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio por tres años y que le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es tener su casa bien arreglada y equipada con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in Rocafuerte canton, the members of Valroc Communal Bank meet. This area is known throughout the country for the delicious sweets made by the locals, and for the warmth of its friendly and hardworking people.

Here we meet Miriam, who is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are 17, 15 and 12 years old. The oldest is at university and the younger ones are in high school. Her husband is a merchant.

She has a bazaar in her house in which she sells not only bazaar items, but also all types of clothing, Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women), and shoes, but in smaller quantities. She works every day from 8 AM until 7 PM. She goes to buy the products in Guayaquil when she needs to stock her business and she also receives merchandise at home. She tells us that she has been working in this business for three years and that it has been going pretty well.

This loan is to buy bazaar items, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing and shoes. She has been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have her house well maintained and equipped with everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy bazaar items, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Hanifahon's Group

texts.en:
Hanifahon B. is the leader of this group. She is 60 and married to a farmer. Her son, 35, works as a surgeon. He has a wife and two children: a son and a daughter. The wife works in the Department of Registration and the children are preschool age (under seven). 

Hanifahon, together with her husband, is engaged in farming. The family owns 1.2 hectares of land; half of the territory they use for cultivating cotton and the other part is used to grow vegetables. Hanifahon believes that this year she will get a good harvest and gain a high profit. With money received from the loan, she plans to purchase mineral fertilizers for the fields. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Domis Yaquelini

texts.es:
Domis es una madre joven de 23 años de edad, ella vive con sus dos menores hijos en casa de su madre en una comunidad urbana en vías de desarrollo llamada José Leonardo Ortiz en Chiclayo.

Domis es vendedora, ella cuenta con una bodega en la cual ofrece desde artículos de escritorio, prendas de vestir y accesorios hasta golosinas y bebidas. La tienda de Domis es una tienda muy concurrida debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece, ella está en este negocio desde hace 2 años y los resultados obtenidos han sido positivos.

La tienda de Domis se encuentra ubicada en un puesto fijo del  mercado Moshoqueque (el mercado de mayor venta y variedad de la región de Lambayeque). Domis conoce a la perfección su negocio pues ella viene de una familia de comerciantes que le han enseñado todo lo necesario para tener un próspero oficio.

Domis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que desea invertir en la compra de mercadería por la campaña del día del padre. Ella piensa obtener un mayor número de ganancias, con esta campaña, las cuales quiere ahorrar para abrir un segundo puesto en otro de los mercados con mayor afluencia del distrito de Chiclayo.

Domis es una mujer luchadora con deseos de superarse y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella cuenta con un buen historial de pagos.
texts.en:
Domis is a 23 year-old mother who lives with her two dependent children in her mother's home, in a developing urban community called José Leonardo Ortiz, in Chiclayo.

Domis is a saleswoman.  She owns a store where she sells stationery products, clothes, accessories, candies and drinks.  Domis' store is very busy owing to the wide variety of products that she sells.  She has been in this business for two years and her results have been positive.

Domis' store is located in a fixed stall in Moshoqueque market (the busiest market with the widest range of products in Lambayeque region).  Domis knows her business to perfection since she comes from a family of salespeople who have taught her all she needs to know in order to run a prosperous business.

Domis is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that she would like to invest in buying merchandise for Fathers Day.  She is planning to make more profits during this sales period.  She would like to save her profits so that she can open up a second sales location in another busier market in Chiclayo district.

Domis is a hard-working woman who has a desire to improve herself and provide her children with a better quality of life.  She has a good payment record.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for Fathers Day

loans.name: Tanya Marisol

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Tanya, tiene 31 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvieron tres hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio.
 
Ella es una gran madre que para que a sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica a trabajar como guardia de seguridad en una empresa en la ciudad de Manta, pero además de esto también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, nos cuenta que todas las noches ella visita a sus clientes para ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra por semanas, su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace varios años  y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Exitosas” (The Successful Ones) meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received attention on a national and international level. This place is where the famous Panama hats are made.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Tanya. She is 31 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children in school (ages 16, 14, and 11).

Tanya is a good mother who makes sure that her children lack nothing. She works as a security guard for a company in the city of Manta. In addition, she sells all types of clothing by going door-to-door and taking requests. She says that she visits her customers in the evenings to offer them her products. Tanya extends credit and then collects payments on a weekly basis. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil as needed. Tanya has been in this business for ten years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. Tanya has been with the Communal Bank for several years and enjoys the convenience of the payments. Her dream is to see her children finish their studies so that they can become successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en: Hazel is married with 1 child. She is 27 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Hazel has operated a general store for 2 years, selling a variety of products. She earns PHP 6,000 monthly. Hazel has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase more products to sell. Hazel has become a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Joel Moisés

texts.en:
Joel Moisés lives in the city of Managua and works in the same city.  He is a responsible person who has a great desire to improve himself both in his work and in his personal life.

Joel Moisés visited our office to request a loan so that he can carry out some projects that he has pending.  Joel says that he will use the loan that he has been awarded to cover some personal expenses, including paying of debts with another banking institution.

Joel is grateful to Ceprodel for having given him this money.

Translated from Spanish:
El señor Joel Moisés  vive en la ciudad de Managua trabajando acá con el fin de llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Es una persona responsable con grandes deseo de superación tanto en su trabajo como en su vida personal.

El señor visitó la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para poder realizar algunas situaciones que tiene pendiente. Dice  don Joel que el crédito que que se le fue otorgada va a utilizarlo en gastos personales (realizar algunas situaciones que tiene pendiente con institucion bancaria.....deuda pendiente)
Don Joel agradece a ceprodel por haberle financiado el dinero

loans.use: to pay off previous debt.

loans.name: Huch

texts.en: Huch, 35 years old, farms and plants vegetables with her husband.  Their income is $14 per day. She has six children, two of whom are working in a factory and the rest of whom help her doing farming. Every month, she has to spend $83 on food, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to hire the workers to clear the grass on the plantation so that her vegetables can grow well. She wants to plant more kinds of vegetables to sell so that she can bring more income to the family and be able to support her children's studies until they finish university.

loans.use: To hire worker to clear the grass in her plantation

loans.name: Norol

texts.en:
Norol is 47 years old and has 8 children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  Norol is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Norol has been farming vegetables for 7 years and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia y su esposo el señor Esteban llevan muchos años de casado, ellos viven en la zona de Mapaizo, cuentan con casa propia en la cual viven con sus cuatro hijos , dos de ellos ya son mayores  y trabajan de manera independiente, los otros dos siguen estudiando en colegio. La señora Virginia llego a nuestra oficina por referencia de su hermana, Doña Virginia se dedica al comercio de ropa y sabanas de manera ambulante en diferentes localidades  como Monteagudo, Mairana, Padilla, etc. Su marido viaja con ella, el cual se dedica también a la venta de ropa interior, la señora Virginia también tiene dos motos propias, las cuales son sus dos hijos mayores los que la trabajan de moto taxi en la zona y le dan renta diaria, el financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería ropa de temporada, ella viaja hasta  Oruro a comprar su mercadería.
texts.en: Virginia and her husband Esteban have been married for many years and live in the Mapaizo area in their own home with their four children. Two of them are grown and work independently and the other two are still studying at school. Virginia discovered Emprender (Kiva Field Partner) through her sister. Virginia sells clothing and sheets in different places such as Monteagudo, Mairana, Padilla, etc. Her husband travels with her and sells underwear. Virginia also has two motorbikes which belong to her two older children who use them for their motortaxi business so they can earn daily income. The loan will be used to buy seasonal clothing. Virginia will travel to Oruro to make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a 29-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest is 7 years old.

Mylene is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She helps her husband cultivate their land and grow rice crops. Mylene also sells fish to the people in her community. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a better income and be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto es empleado y realiza trabajos de limpieza en una oficina de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción para la refacción del alcantarillado de su casa. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona de Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz;  es divorciado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Alberto is employed cleaning an office in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to buy building materials and supplies to repair his house’s sewage system.  He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Tacagua zone.  He’s divorced and has two children.  This is the first time the client has gotten an IMPRO loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Andrita Calapiz Group

texts.en:
Andrita is a widow with four children. Andrita is 65 years-old and lives in East Poblacion, Rizal.

Andrita sells assorted groceries to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 in order to purchase housing materials needed for house repair.

Andrita has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for four years.  In the future, Andrita hope to improve the living situation of her family from the income generated from her business.

Andrita is the leader of a four person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials (plywood, nails. etc.)

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is from the village Varkhani. She is 50 years old, married, and lives with her husband, Merab, two sons (27 and 26 years old) and a daughter-in-law. 

The family is busy with an agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm. Milk is used for cheese production, which is sold locally. Along with the dairy, Nunu trades second-hand clothes. She purchases clothes at a wholesale price and then sells them in her shop and nearby villages at a retail price. 

Nunu requested credit for purchasing seasonal clothes for resale. She will offer a wide assortment of the clothes to the customers and increase her sales, and, consequently, her profit. She will reinvest part of the profit in the same business, and the other part will be used for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.ru: Махфуза умная и честная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Её муж частный предприниматель и имеет свою пекарню. Она занимается купля продажей женских одежд в магазине. Её магазин находиться на центре города в населенном пункте.  Она привозить высококачественные товары из Турции. Более 7 лет она успешно продолжает данный бизнес и у неё очень хороший опыт. Махфуза хотела бы получить займ в размере $3000 США для покупки сезонной женской одежды из Турции.
texts.en: Mahfuza is a smart and honest woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of two children.  Her husband is an honest entrepreneur and has his own bakery.  Mahfuza is involved in buying and selling women's clothing at a store.  Her store is located in a populated area in the town center.  She brings in high quality merchandise from Turkey.  She has been successfully running this business for over 7 years and has a very good experience in it.  Mahfuza wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of seasonal women's clothing from Turkey.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women's clothing

loans.name: Abdullahuman

texts.en:
Abdullahuman is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli, in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three and a half years, Abdullahuman has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells many different kinds of food items and household supplies. 

To help expand his business, Abdullahuman has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and drinks and will help Abdullahuman to generate greater profits and finish his family's first home. Abdullahuman hopes that in the future he will be able to start a transporting business. 

Abdullahuman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves microentrepreneurs like Abdullahuman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Mariana Del Jesús

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte (Portoviejo) se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de un  hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad  pero  aun vive en su casa con su mujer y su pequeño hijo.
 
Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa el cual consiste en  preparar y vender bocadillos, hamburguesas y dulces de muchas formas y sabores, trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00  hasta las 16h00, ella vende en su casa al menudeo y al por mayor a comerciantes que llegan a comprar sus productos para luego llevarlos a vender a otros lugares. Lleva más de 20 años e este negocio y esto le ayudo a sacar adelante a su hijo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para la preparación de los productos que ella vende. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos  que le ayudan mucho en su negocio. 
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
In Rocafuerte Canton (Portoviejo) the members of the “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” (Unity Makes Strength) communal bank meet every two weeks.  This place is known for the delicious sweets the locals make that are famous nation-wide.

We met Mariana, 47, here.  She’s a single mother of a son who is an adult now but still lives at home with his wife and small son.

She has a small home-based business consisting in preparing snacks, hamburgers and sweets of various shapes and flavors to sell.  She works every day from 9am until 4pm.  She sells at home at retail and also at wholesale to merchants that come by her house to buy and then take her products to other places to sell.  She’s been in this business over 20 years and it has allowed her to raise her son.

This loan is to buy foodstuffs for the preparation of the products she sells.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans help her in her business very much.  Her dreams are to continue moving forward and to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.es: Sheila, de 50 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, está casada con Kenneth, vive en compañía de su esposo, su ultimo hijo de 14 años de edad y su nieto al cual está criando y dándole todas las atenciones, instalados cómodamente en una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Sheila, es el alquiler de habitaciones  para personas solteras, iniciándose hace 10 años en este negocio con dos habitaciones  que acondicionó en su propia casa con los ahorros que tenía con su pareja. Además por avanzada edad decidieron incursionar en este rubro, porque mas adelante necesitarían un ingreso económico para poder pagar sus gastos de alimentación, y ahora posee 5 habitaciones muy bien instaladas. Lo que le gusta de su actividad, además, de los ingresos económicos, es el poder contar con la compañía de sus inquilinos, a los que considera sus amigos, ya que algunos de ellos, llevan alquilando esas habitaciones varios años. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es que algunos de sus inquilinos dejan las habitacionesen mal estado. A pesar de eso, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y construir ó acondicionar un mini departamento que piensa alquilarlo a mayor precio. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con su objetivo. Por  otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, los invertirá en el arreglo y pintado de las paredes de las habitaciones, como también en el arreglo del desagüe.
texts.en:
50-year-old Sheila is a hard-working and cheerful woman.  She is married to Kenneth and lives with her husband, her youngest son (who is 14), and her grandson who she is raising and giving all her attention to.  The family are living comfortably in a house that they own.

Sheila's business is renting out rooms to single people.  She started this business 10 years ago with two rooms which she fitted out in her own home with some savings that she and her partner had.  They decided to start out in this line of work because they are getting on in years and, in the future, they will need an income so that they can cover their food expenses.  They now have five rooms which are very well equipped.

What Sheila enjoys about her business, in addition to the income she makes, is having the company of her tenants, who she considers her friends as some of them have been renting these rooms for several years.  On the other hand, what she does not like about her work is that some of her tenants leave the rooms in a bad state of repair.  In spite of this, Sheila has plans to expand her business and build, or fit out, a mini apartment which she plans to rent out at a higher price.

This will be Sheila's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her goal.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Sheila will invest the sum that she has requested in fixing up and painting the walls of her rental rooms.  She will also fix the drainage.

loans.use: to buy paint and to fix the drainage in her rental rooms

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is 33 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children.

To earn a living, Arlen has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Arlen has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business. Arlen has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. 

In the future, Arlen would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Ma.jenny

texts.en:
Ma.Jenny is 39 years old, married, and has seven children, four of whom are in school.

Ma.Jenny is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma.Jenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alba Carolina

texts.es:
Alba Carolina tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres y tiene una hija, es madre soltera, Alba Carolina se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y sandalias, su negocio esta bien ubicado, esta en una zona en donde transitan muchas personas,  muy temprano se traslada en su bicicleta a abrir su negocio, sus ventas son de lunes a sabado y algunas veces los domingos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y sandalias, desea surtir el negocio ya que se aproxima la navidad y desea aprovechar dicha epoca para vender un poco mas y asi obtener mejores ganancias, las cuales necesita para curbrir los gastos de su hija.
texts.en:
Alba Carolina is 28 years old and lives at home with her parents.  She has one daughter and is a single mother.  Alba Carolina works selling new clothes and sandals.  Her business is in a good location, in an area where a lot of people pass through.  Very early she travels by bike to open her business.  The store is open from Monday through Saturday, and sometimes on Sundays.

She will use her loan to buy clothing and sandals.  She hopes to stock her business since the Christmas season approaches and she wants to take advantage of that period to sell a bit more and thus obtain better earnings.  She needs her earnings to cover the expenses of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sandals

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 31-year-old mother of five from the Negev in southern Israel. She has an after-school and daycare center in her village. She provides excellent care, a loving environment and educational activities for the children in her care.
Sahar is requesting this loan to purchase new toys, kitchen equipment, tables and chairs. 
In the future, Sahar wants to further expand her childcare business, create a more open area and update her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 38-year-old married woman with six children ranging in age from five to 20. For the past five years, she has operated a store where she sells clothes. Jane describes herself as loving. Her business is located a viable area and her primary customers are women. Jane's biggest business challenge is inadequate funds. 

Jane is requesting a 20,000 KES to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to have enough capital to be able to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Karima

texts.en: Karima is a 41 year old marreid woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan who helps support 2 family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for packaging to wrap the chocolates that she sells. She would like to expand this project and eventually buy and open a shop to sell the products.

loans.use: to pay for packaging for chocolates

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 48 years married with 5 children and all attend school. He operates a retail shop mainly selling of soap, cooking oil among other items. 

He hopes to expand his business and pay school fees for his children although he price fluctuations like other people dealing in the same business. 

He is seeking for credit to buy more maize for sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize for sell.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Introducing Irine, who is a tireless worker who works seven days a week, 12 hours per day. This is all because she wants to achieve her dream of giving her children a good education.

Irine is a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpments. She has been farming for the past 10 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village.

She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Irine is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandi Hills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Irine could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Irine, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Irine believes that this loan will be of much help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Irine to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Like Irine, many women smallholder farmers wait for your help. Get inspired, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila is 51 years old. She is a widow with 2 children. She is the only supporter of her family. The permanent income of her family is low. Since 2001, Nazila has run her business for the maintenance of her family. She sells patties and, through this, makes her living.

In 2004 she borrowed her first loan in the amount of $200 from Norwegian Microcredit.

Now she needs the sum of $300 to expand her business. She would like to buy a new electric griddle plate. This will enable her to fry more patties and serve more clients in shorter time and thus to improve her family budget.

loans.use: To buy the new electric griddle plate.

loans.name: Anna Lum

texts.en:
Anna L. is one of two wives with seven children. Thoughts of the bad treatment she got from her maid, moments she and her kids felt sick and could not go to hospital for services, and internal guilt at not being able to pay for her children’s tuition is her motivation for going into business. Her immediate goal is to provide education for her children, while her long-term goal is to build a house where she can live in peace with her children.

With the help of past loans she succeeded in selling foodstuffs to her community. She is proud of having used the profit from her empowerment-credit activities to pay for two of her children’s school fees.

With a loan of $1000, she plans to increase her stock by buying cassava, yam, ibo coco-yam, and pepper in large quantities and retailing to other women who don’t have capital. She is convinced that her business will succeed because of the high demand from the population of the Bamenda urban center, her determination, empowerment skills acquired, and the peer support she is getting from her group members in GHAPE.

She plans to pay the loan off in 18 months. The first installment repayment will be made in the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Trading and Farming

loans.name: Fatmata K.

texts.en: Fatmata is 30 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband is self-employed, providing a taxi service with his motorbike. Before she got a small space in the market for her business, Fatmata was a hawker specializing in making local shampoo. With her first loan she diversified her business and moved into the local market. She now sells her shampoo, other cosmetics and sundries. Both Fatmata and husband are determined to expand their businesses and earn sufficient income to keep providing for their children.

loans.use: Fatmata would like to ncrease her stock of cosmetics and sundries for her small shop.

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.en:
Ladislao Cespesdes, 45, is married to Marta Rojas. They make and sell chipas, a very popular type of corn bread in Paraguay. They work 3 days a week and have been running their chipas business for 38 years now. They spend the mornings from 7 am until 12 pm making the chipas in the large brick oven they have outside of their house. Then Ladislao, Marta, and their 7 children all help in selling the chipas. They travel to Asuncion carrying their baskets filled with chipas to sell in the streets and on buses until they sell all the chipas, usually lasting until 7 pm. They make about 12 kilos of chipa everytime, which is about 320 chipas.

On the days that they are not working, Ladislao goes fishing that he uses for food for the family. The couple is seeking a $300 loan to buy more supplies to make chipas, such as cheese, milk, and eggs. They are also considering investing in a new oven.

Ladislao is also a member of a commitee for men and women. He is part of a group lending system where members provide collateral though a group repayment pledge and the incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members will be responsible for making up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, milk, eggs and a new oven.

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en: Guloglan is 44 years old, married andhas 2 children. He lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. He has run his farming business  for 10 years and now requests a loan of $725 to buy pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.en:
Martha brings true joy to all who are lucky enough to cross her path. Her mother, who owned a ‘panadería’, was Martha’s inspiration for her ‘Dulces’ business. Martha can be found walking the crowded sidewalks of her neighborhood in Lima all hours of the day, toting her box full of breads and sweets to sell. She has several regulars that come by the same time each day to satiate their sweet tooth.

Martha has been selling dulces on the street for six years now, and it can be very exhausting carrying all of her inventory with her all day. With this loan she will expand her inventory so she can work towards her long-term goal of renting her own store, which would be much less stressful.

Martha is married and they have three children, ages 18, 17, and 16. Martha’s dreams for her children are coming true and she couldn’t be happier; she has always dreamt that they would become self-sustaining professionals. Her oldest is now in college studying law, her youngest still in high school, and her middle child will graduate this year and plans to go to college to become a teacher. Martha says that being self-sustaining is the greatest “herencia”, or inheritance, you can leave your children, because you never know what life will bring you, and it’s best to be prepared for it.

loans.use: expand her inventory with the long-term goal of renting her own store

loans.name: Sixta

texts.en:
Sixta is in her early fifties and is a single mother of seven daughters. They all are working.

Sixta runs a general store that she started fifteen years ago. Her store is well known and people visit it every day to purchase rice, vegetable oil, milk, chocolate, and a large assortment of basic foodstuffs. She also sells plucked chickens and boiled beans. Sixta says she has got a lot of experience and skills from these years of running her business. She used to sell on credit but people often took unfair advantage of her kindness and they didn´t want to pay on time. Now, she only takes cash.

Sixta needs funds to re-supply her store with a lot of products such as beer, rice, and sugar because those goods are running out. This will be the second loan she will have taken from our organization. Sixta has a good credit history and we are sure that she will manage to make her business grow and repay this second loan successfully . Her dream is to have a big store with a very big clientele, where she can sell a large assortment of goods.

loans.use: Purchase goods to supply a general store

loans.name: Glaris Elita

texts.es:
The small business owner Glaris Elita B. is 57 years old and comes from Bluefields and the creole ethnic group. She has 2 children and for over 25 years has sold vegetables at this city's municipal market. Due to her knowledge of the creole language and because she is known for being a native of the region, her stand is visited often by people of creole descent. It is important to note that not many people of creole descent work in the sale of vegetables. These products are in high demand in this city since it is customary for its inhabitants to consume plenty of vegetables.

She needs to purchase the following: 40 units of cabbage at US$ 1 per unit, 500 units of bananas at US$ 0.05 per unit, 500 units of plantains at US$ 0.16 per unit, 100 lbs of onions at US$ 0.42 per lb, 200 units of coconut at US$ 0.42 per unit , 5 sacks of yucca at US$ 8 each sack, 3 sacks of quequisques at US$ 24 per sack and 2 sacks of potatoes at US$ 48 per sack.

Translated from the Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La microempresaria Glaris Elita W. B. tiene 57 años de edad, es originaria de Bluefields, de la etnia creole, es acompañada, tiene dos hijos y se dedica desde hace mas de 25 años a la venta de verduras en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad. Este negocio es bastante visitado por personas de la etnia creole por la facilidad que tiene de la lengua creole doña Glaris y por que es reconocida por ser nativa de la region. Hay que señalar que no son muchas las personas de la etnia creole que se dedican a la venta de verduras. Este producto es consumido mucho en esta ciudad por la costumbre de sus habitantes de comer verduras. Necesita comprar lo siguiente: 40 unidades de repollo a US$ 1 dolar cada unidad, 500 unidades de banano a US$ 0.05 cada unidad, 500 unidades de platanos a US$ 0.16 cada unidad, 100 libras de cebolla a US$ 0.42 cada libra, 200 unidades de coco a US$ 0.42 cada unidad, 5 sacos de yuca a US$ 8 cada saco, 3 sacos de quequisques a US$ 24 cada saco, y 2 sacos de papas a US$ 48 cada saco.

loans.use: To purchase 40 units of cabbage, 500 units of bananas, 500 units of plantains, 100 lbs of onions, 200 units of coconut, 5 sacks of yucca, 3 sacks of quequisques and 2 sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Amida's Wailes Taifa Group

texts.en:
Amida A., age 33, is married with 2 children (1 and 12 years old). Amida owns a used/spare parts shop, which she started 2 years ago. Working from 8am-6pm daily, she earns about $900 a month from this business.

In the past, Amida successfully took out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more spare parts for her business. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. Amida belongs to the loan group called Wailes Taifa and will be sharing this loan with subgroup members Wiseza Muhimu and Mwisi W.. These women have businesses dealing in cothing and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more used accessories

loans.name: Berena's Uchumi Group

texts.en:
Berena is a divorced woman. She has been selling bananas since in 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Berena has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a store.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born May 12th, 1975 in Lomé, Mrs. Adjo D. is married and the mother of four children. Since 1990, she has been running a small grocery store in the Békpota neighborhood. She often receives help from her husband Mr. SAVADOGO who is a retailer. She has already received two consecutive loans of 300,000 francs CFA. She is now seeking a loan of 450,000 francs CFA. Half of the loan will allow her to purchase 12 boxes of milk, 24 boxes of canned foods, and 12 boxes of soap. The other half will help her to begin selling cosmetic products. In this way she will be able to diversify her business to improve revenues and better contribute to family expenses.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 12 mai 1975 à Lomé, Madame D. Adjo est mariée et a quatre (4) enfants qui fréquentent tous. Depuis 1990, elle a ouvert une boutique des produits de premières nécessité dans le quartier Bè kpota. Elle est souvent assistée par son mari SAVADOGO qui est un revendeur. Elle a obtenu deux (2) fois successives les crédits de 300.000FCFA. Elle sollicite un crédit de 450.000 FCFA. La moitié de ce crédit lui permettra d’acheter douze (12) cartons de lait, vingt quatre (24) de boîtes de conserve et douze (12) cartons de savons. La moitié lui servira de débuter le commerce des produits cosmétiques. Ainsi elle pourra varier son activité pour améliorer ses recettes envue de participer aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase stock in basic goods

loans.name: Fedelis' Keko Group

texts.en:
Fedelis, age 32, is married with a three year old son. He owns a phone card business where he sells vouchers from 7am to 8pm daily. He started this work a year back and now makes about $460 a month from his sales.

In the past, Fedelis borrowed a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more phone vouchers. Having paid this back successfully, he now hopes for a new loan to start up his voucher business in another location. He will share this loan with his subgroup, whose members have cafe, soft drink, clothing, and food vending businesses. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Fedelis is standing on the right.

loans.use: To buy more phone vouchers to sell

loans.name: Ramata

texts.en:
Ramata S. sells fast food including fried eggs, Indomie (instant noodle soup), fried yam, tea and jollof rice at her small shade located at the corner of the Iyana-Iba market. She sells mostly to labourers in the market. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She lives at Iyanagbaja, Lagos State, Nigeria. She acquired her skill over a 2-year period and has been in the business since 2002.

Ramata has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. She now needs a loan of $350 to buy more eggs, indomie, yams, and rice so that she can expand her business and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy more fast food (eggs, indomie,yam and rice) for sales

loans.name: Alassivi Afiavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Alassivi Afiavi M., 28 and the mother of two children, was born in Lomé and lives in a neighborhood quite removed from the city center of Lomé. At a young age, she learned how to run a business from her mother. At 17, she opened her own business. It consists in buying various grocery products wholesale in the big open-air market of Lomé. She then retails them in her neighborhood, where she has a monopoly. She took out a first loan and repaid it correctly. She is now requesting a second loan to expand her inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 28 ans, mère de deux enfants, madame M. Alassivi Afiavi née à Lomé vit dans un quartier assez reculé de la ville de Lomé. Initiée depuis son jeune âge aux activités commerciales par sa maman. A l’âge de 17 ans, elle a monté son propre commerce. Cela consiste en l’achat en gros des divers produits d’alimentation générale dans le grand marché de Lomé. Elle les revend ensuite en détail dans son quartier où elle détient le monopole. Elle a pris un premier crédit qu’elle a bien payé. Elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use:
Purchase of staples for re-sale

Achat des produits de premières nécessités

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla A. is over 37 years old, married and a father of 3 children. He lives 100 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. He owns an air pump machine with which he repairs car and motor bike tires. With this new credit, he would like to invest into a new engine which seems to already be defective and causes frequent breakdowns. The renewal of his equipment will help him to spend less and save more.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Komla A. est âgé de plus de 37ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite à 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. II est propriétaire d’une machine de pompe à air dont il tient son exploitation pour réparer les pneux des voitures et moto. Avec ce nouveau crédit,il désire investir de nouveau en renouvellant le moteur qui semble être déjà amorti ce qui est source de fréquentes pannes . Le renouvellement duson équipement lui permettra de dépenser moins et d’épargner plus.

loans.use: Purchase of new motor

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 46 years old. She is married with 1 child. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Riziki is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Zulviyya

texts.en: Zulfiyya, is 32 years old, is a widow, and has one child. She lives in Khachmaz town.  Zulfiyya buys agricultural produce for pickies and then sells them. She would like a loan of  $750 to buy agricultural produce for pickies to increase her output.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem N. lives in Chek Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Moeurn Meth, are farmers who own a 1.3 hectare field which they cultivate to earn their living. On their plantation, they now have a problem because the soil is infertile. In order to deal with this situation, Mrs. Yem N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for her pump to water her crop. Mrs. Yem N. is 44 years old and the mother of two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her field and fuel to run her pump to water her crop.

loans.name: Sokkha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokkha C. lives in Parna village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Lim Channy, sell shoes. The business is doing well and they want to purchase more shoes, so Mrs. Sokkha C. decided to request a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 27 years old and the mother of one young child. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San T., 39, is married and lives with five of her children and her husband in Kampong Cham Province. She works as a farmer together with her husband, and they typically make $5 a day. This couple grows mushrooms, puts them in the packaging, and then sells them to their customers. Two of their children are students and three are employed as garment factory workers.

San T. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to purchase fertilizers and other tools to grow more mushrooms.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for growing mushrooms.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Madame  Binta  S. est âgée de 35 ans et  vit avec son mari et  ses 4  enfants en location avec plusieurs autres ménages au quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elle abandonna l’école en classe de 9 ème pour se marier. Elle débuta la préparation du pâté auprès de sa belle sœur. Son apprentissage n’a pris que 4 jours .dès lors  elle est sollicitée par les services et ONG quand ces derniers organisent des ateliers et colloques. Elle bénéficie  d’une très grande clientèle, étant connue dans son milieu,  le soir son lieu de vente regorge de beaucoup de clients.
Pour faire du pâté, elle utilise les matières premières suivantes : 3kgs de farine de blé ; 1/2kgs de viande hachées, 30 oeufs, du beurre et 4 bols d’eau. Le mélange ainsi obtenu, en pâte est découpé sur une planche en des morceaux de farine de blé dans lesquels est encastré de la viande hachée. Le tout passera après dans la poêle avant d’être consommé.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation  depuis 30 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et un premier prêt individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 50 kgs de farine de blé, 3 bidons d’huiles, 15 alvéoles d’œufs et de la viande journalièrement. Elle s’approvisionne en matière première sur place au grand marché de  Ségou. Madame  Binta  S. vend au comptant et à crédit,à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui lui permettra de supporter certaines charges familiales. Son ambition est d’avoir une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Binta S. is 35 and lives with her husband and their four children together with several other households in the Médine neighbourhood of the town of Ségou, in Mali. She left school during Grade 9 to get married. She started making meatpies with her sister-in-law. Her apprenticeship lasted only four days. Since then she has been in high demand from services and NGOs (Non-Governmental Agencies) when they hold workshops and colloquiums. She has many clients as she is well-known in her neighborhood. In the evenings, she has many customers where she sells. To make the meatpies, she uses the following: 3 kilograms of wheat flour; 1/2 kilogram of ground meat, 30 eggs, butter, and 4 bowls of water. Once everything is mixed to a paste, she places and cuts the wheat-flour paste in which the ground meat is embedded. Once they are cooked, the meatpies can be eaten. To satisfy her ever-increasing clientele, she is turning to the microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 30 months. She has three previous group loans and one previous individual loan, which have all been repaid. This will be her second individual loan. She will buy 50 kilograms of wheat flour, 3 drums of oil, 15 flats of eggs and meat on a daily basis. She buys her ingredients locally at the main market in Ségou. Binta Soutoura sells for cash and on credit, both to men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA with this loan, which will allow her to contribute to some of the family's expenses. Her goal is to have a house.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, oil, eggs, and meat.

loans.name: Ramón Ruben

texts.es:
El señor Ramón Pérez se desempeña en su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se ha destacado por ser un excelente comerciante que a diario desde muy tempranas horas atiende en su establecimiento.

Es de importancia destacar que el señor Ramón se esfuerza diariamente en su negocio, trasladando los perecederos hasta el mercado con el propósito de venderlos. La razón por la que el señor Pérez busca el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de dichos perecederos para su respectiva venta y así mejorar sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Ramón Pérez takes pride in his business selling fruit and vegetables. He runs a stand in the central market in the city of Chinadega. He is a dedicated merchant, working daily beginning in the early morning.

It is important to highlight that Ramón works diligently every day, transporting his produce to the market to sell. Ramón is hoping for a loan so that he can continue to buy his produce, maintaining his business and improving his economic condition.

(Translated by Ally of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Fruit and Vegetables

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a widow. She sells children's clothing at Melitopol central market. Her income is 2,500 UAH per month.

Galina has been in this business for 12 years. She likes selling children's clothing because she just loves children. Besides that she puts good prices on her goods and treats her clients well. Galina lives by herself in a small apartment. Galina’s business is the only source of income.

Galina would like to borrow a loan to increase inventory. Galina uses her income to help her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 21 años, vive con su pareja, su hermana y su prima, personas que la apoyan mucho en su negocio. Ella tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en espacio que acondicionó en su casa. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año y cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana y prima, con quienes atienden la bodega durante todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que conoce a muchas personas y tiene amenas conversaciones, además le es rentable porque en el lugar donde está ubicada es el único negocio de abarrotes que hay, por lo que sus productos se venden a diario. Su anhelo a futuro es tener un minimarket. Es la segunda vez que Luz tiene un préstamo con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos son responsables y existe mucho diálogo entre ellos, además que aprende mucho de su asesor de crédito. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes; sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, entre otras cosas de consumo constante.
texts.en:
Luz is 21 years old and lives with her partner, her sister and her cousin, all of whom support her a lot with her business. She sells groceries and other household necessities in a part of her house which she remodeled for her business. It's been a year since she was able to achieve this, and she has the assistance of her sister and cousin who also help look after the store during the day. What she likes about her business is that she gets to know many people and have pleasant conversations with them. Moreover, the business is profitable because it is the only grocery store located in the area and as a result they are selling their products every day. Her hope for the future is to have a mini-mart. This is the second time that Luz has taken a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She likes working with her communal bank because everyone is so responsible and they have a lot of dialog among themselves. And she has also learned a lot from her credit advisor. The money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries such as sacks of rice, sugar and boxes of milk, among other such constantly consumed items.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Afde N°3 Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE N°3  ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Cité Lamy (région de Thiès). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de poissons et légumes. Elles sont très sollicitées dans ces activités. Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de micro finance IMCEC avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).  Leur premier prêt était  correctement remboursé. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour constituer un stock important de poissons et légumes. Les poissons et légumes sont vendus en détail, au comptant au marché grand Thiès.  Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35 000FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
“Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE No. 3” is composed of five women who average 40 years of age living in large traditional extended families in the Cité Lamy district (Thiès region). They know one another through ties of community and kinship, and they do almost the same work, selling fish and vegetables. They are in high demand in this business.

With regard to improving the quality of their services and expanding their businesses, the members of this reliance group decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC, with which they are now on their second solidarity loan (group loan). Their first loan was correctly repaid.

The group members plan to use this loan to build up a sizable stock of fish and vegetables, which are sold retail in cash transaction at the Grand Thiès marketplace. Each group member hopes to realize an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for family needs, and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster their business

loans.name: Saida Alicia

texts.es:
Saida es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras.
Saida es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, Saida vende cebiche de manera ambulatoria en el estadio de su distrito, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, también en época de fiestas vende comida típica. Además Saida vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares.
Saida necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de cerdo.
Los sueños de Saida son tener un puesto estable en el mercado, culminar sus estudios de enfermería.
texts.en:
Saida is a member of the Palmeras [Palm trees] Community Bank. She is single, 21 years old and lives with her parents. Saida is a street vendor. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells cebiche [raw fish served in lemon or lime juice, onion, salt and garlic] at her district's stadium. She also sells traditional foods during holiday seasons. In addition, Saida sells cosmetics by taking catalogue orders from friends and family members. Saida needs a loan of 600 soles [about US $200], which she will invest in the purchase of pork. Saida's dreams are to have a permanent stand in the market and to complete her nursing studies.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pork

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija has been a clothes and bites (bread-like rolls) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for a year. She belongs to M'masikini group loan (Group code 2064). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $125. Every day she works at her business for twelve hours.

Khadija is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Khadija is 22 years old and single.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell and wheat flour and cooking oil to make bites

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María de la Concepción D. tiene la edad de 50 años, es una madre soltera. María tiene a su cargo 2 hijos y ambos estudian. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, además de poseer este medio de vida labora en un hospital de enfermera, por lo que su vida es muy complicada ya que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para atender a su hijo y recurrir a su trabajo, los fines de semana los dedica a visitar a sus amistades para realizar la venta de sus productos. María se ha beneficiado mucho con los financiamientos porque todos han sido con el fin de ayudar de sacar adelante su negocio, es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de belleza, cremas, cosméticos, ropa para mujeres y caballeros. El sueño de María es la preparar a sus hijos y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María de la Concepción D. is 50 years old and is a single mother. She has two children in school. She has had a business selling general merchandise for more than 3 years. She also works in a hospital as a nurse; therefore her life is very complicated as she has to get up very early to take care of her child and go to work. On the weekends she visits friends to sell her products. María has benefited a lot from loans since they have helped her get ahead with her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase beauty products, creams, cosmetics, women's clothes and men's clothes. María’s dream is to educate her children and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment

loans.name: Mian Jurani

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is a bonafide resident of Cabgan Pta. Miray, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old, married and blessed with 1 child. She owns and operates a business venture raising livestock and pigs for sale. She earns 4,500 php per month from her business.

Recently, she's requesting her 1st loan in the amount of 2,000 php that she will use for additional capital for fishing materials for her husband. Her future plan for her family is that she would be able to pay for her child's schooling up through college so her child or children will find decent and stables job someday.

loans.use: capital for pig raising

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 29 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años cría ganado vacuno, específicamente toros, los cuales vende en las ferias ganaderas y a los más robustos los mantiene permanentemente para darlos en alquiler como toros para el arado, de esta manera obtiene los ingresos económicos necesarios para su familia. Dedicarse a la ganadería ha sido más beneficioso que la agricultura, pues las ganancias son con mayor frecuencia y con menos riesgo de pérdida. Para el futuro, William planifica tener un establo bien equipado para albergar a mayor cantidad de animales. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy entusiasmado por trabajar en su banco comunal, donde como nuevo integrante se compromete a ser muy activo y a aportar para el desarrollo común. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de  un torete para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
William is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house they own. He has been raising livestock for 2 years, specifically bulls, that he sells at the livestock markets. He keeps the larger bulls to lease out for plowing and, this way, generate the necessary income for his family. Dedicating himself to livestock has been more beneficial than farming, given that earnings are generated more frequently and there is less risk of loss. For the future, William plans to have a well-outfitted stable where he can house a greater number of animals. This is his first loan through MFP. He is very enthusiastic about working with his cooperative bank where, as a new member, he promises to be very active and work towards the common good of the members. The funds he is requesting will be destined for buying a bull and to increase his working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
Carmen, es socia del Banco Comunal “6 de Enero”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad y es soltera, sin hijos, ella pudo estudiar sus de educación superior (Economía), vive en el Barrio Progreso.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para adquirir Recargas virtuales para su negocio.

Ella desea mejorar su negocio, por ello requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, con dicho préstamo ella podrá adquirir tarjetas físicas y tarjetas virtuales para su locutorio

Su sueño es poder una sucursal  y comprar nuevo equipos.

La dinámica de trabajo  y la confianza que hay en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the 6 de Enero Community Bank in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 28, single, and she does not have children. She has a university education in Economics. She lives in the Progreso neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost one year. She used her first loan for 500 PEN to get rechargeable virtual mobile phone cards for her business. She wishes to improve her business. To do so she needs an additional loan for 1,000 PEN. She will use the loan to get actual physical and virtual phone cards for her call center. Her dream is to be able to have a branch and to buy new equipment. (She likes) the work dynamic and the confidence that exists in the Community Bank.
