Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy actual physical and virtual phone cards

loans.name: Kemuning Sari Group

texts.en: Ni Putu Miryani (-) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu. She is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Kemuning Sari (DNR.M-0592). Ni Putu Miryani is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Putu Miryani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 1,100,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 4th from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** NI Putu Miryani - (-) merupakan 35 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu. NI Putu Miryani adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 13 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Kemuning Sari (DNR.M-0592). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. NI Putu Miryani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, NI Putu Miryani menghasilkan sekitar 0,300 IDR. Dalam 2008, NI Putu Miryani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. NI Putu Miryani telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.100.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie (or Naning, as she is know to friends and neighbors) lives in the village of Labni Mabuslo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Romulo, who makes a living farming vegetables. Both of them are doing their best to earn enough money to live well.  

Marjorie contributes to the family's income by running a sari-sari (or community-based) store. Her desire to expand this business has motivated her to apply for a loan for PHP 5,000.00.  She will use this loan to buy more groceries to sell to her customers. She hopes that she can count on your support to help make this possible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de mèches

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de siete hijos de los cuales cinco son mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de aguaje (fruta de la región) al por mayor y menor, también vende gaseosas, tiene un puesto el mercado de bellavista de esta localidad, este negocio lo realiza con su esposo pues ambos trabajan juntos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Solteritas” desde hace dos años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que fue utilizado para comprar gaseosa y vender en el mercado, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra de sacos de aguajes para vender. La meta de Norma es tener una tienda y ser distribuidora de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Norma is a dynamic and collaborative woman that lives in Pucallpa, a city in the Ucayali region. She is 44 years old and is the mother of seven children, five of whom are of age. For a living she sells aguajes (a local fruit) as well as soda. She has stand in the Bellavista Market in her city, a business she runs the with her husband- the two of them work together. For two years she has been part of the Banco Comunal Las Solteritas; the first loan she received was 300 soles which she used to buy soda to sell in the market. She now needs a credit of 1200 soles so that she can purchase bags of aguajes to sell. Norma's goal is to have a store and be a soda distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchace of bags of aguajes (local fruit)

loans.name: Marannatha 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Edline is a 33-year-old borrower from Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Marannatha (Christ is Coming), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Edline and the Marannatha group live in a difficult part of Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. Although most of the city has access to running water and somewhat reliable electricity, their neighborhood has none. Edline is a single mother of one, a three-year-old son. Despite raising her child on her own and living in a difficult part of town, Edline runs a successful small business selling clothing to her neighbors and friends.

With her new loan, Edline will buy “ropa de paca”, or packs of used clothing, usually from the United States. This is a common way for people to purchase clothes here; it is cheap and, although used, the clothes are usually in great condition. With the profits from her expanding business, Edline hopes to send her son through school, all the way up through university. This way he can have opportunities that were not available to her as a child. Thank you for lending to Edline and the Marannatha group!

loans.use: Packs of used clothing

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 39 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a commercial tailor. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty; in the future, she wants to own a supermarket. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN; with that money, she will purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thank you in advance to all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca K. is 36 years old and married to James Kibet who is 40 years old. Prisca has been blessed with three children: Hesbon Kiprotich (13 years, form 2), Faith Jepkemoi (10 years, class 8), and Jane Kimosop (7 years, class 4).
Prisca owns a mini hardware store, which she started four years ago. The store is in Kabarnet town and most of her customers are Kabarnet residents or from nearby villages. She earns a profit of 10,000 KES a month and an additional income of 3,000 KES from other sources.
This loan is Prisca's second loan from Kiva partner KADET – her first loan was for 35,000 KES and she repaid it well. Prisca plans to use this loan to expand her business by purchasing more hardware stock, such as jembes, sprayers, hammers, spades, and even a power saw. If this loan improves her business, Prisca plans to expand her business from retail to wholesale and educate her children to the highest level of education. Prisca describes herself as a hardworking and dedicated businesswoman.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy new stock for her hardware business

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Yadira C. tiene su propio establecimiento de venta de bebidas como jugos, gaseosas y agua de botella. Estos productos son ofrecidos por  ella misma a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

El negocio tiene 15 años de existencia y es importante señalar que ella inició con pocos productos a la venta pero a medida que se ha venido desarrollando, ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida y la de su negocio.

Ella se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos anteriores que le ha brindado Ceprodel porque los ha utilizado en la compra de los productos y estos le han generado utilidades los cuales le han servido mucho para pagar los estudios de sus dos hijos ya que ella es madre soltera.
El crédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de las bebidas jugos, gaseosas y agua para continuar ofreciéndolas en su localidad.
texts.en:
Yadira C. sells beverages like juices, soft-drinks and bottled water from her establishment in the department of León. She, herself, tends to her sales daily from very early in the morning until nightfall. She has been in this line of work for 15 years and it's important to point out that she began with just a few products in her inventory but, as she has been developing, both her business and her living conditions have improved. She is very satisfied with the loans that Ceprodel has approved for her in the past because she has used them to buy products and they have generated profits that she has been able to use to pay for her two children's schooling; she is a single mother. The financing requested on this occasion will be used to buy juices, soft-drinks, and bottled water in order to continue to offer them for sale in her location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Sandra is a hardworking woman of thirty-five years, who owns a grocery store located in Ishaka town called Diplomatic Pub. She is married and has two children.

Sandra is using the loan to purchase more inventory for her store. She is a dedicated business woman whose future dream is to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items for the purpose of expanding her business.

loans.name: Rosemary Banuelo's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary B. is from the village of Canubay. She is 35 years old. Rosemary is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Rosemary Banuelo's group'.

Rosemary is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosemary owns & operates a dried fish vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Aside from dried fish, she also sells peanut butter. Rosemary has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Rosemary joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemary has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rosemary is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Rosemary from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sherdil

texts.ru: Сафаров Шердил проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 23 года. Женат, не имеет детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Шердил торговлей занимается более 4 лет. Он в основном продает диски (DVD, CD) и аудио кассеты. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sherdil S. lives in the town of Kulob. He is 23 years old. He is married and has no children. His wife is a housewife. Sherdil himself has been in sales for more than four years. He mainly sells CD's, DVD's and audio tapes. He is asking for a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Adam

texts.fr:
Madame Adam B.  est âgée de 54 ans, mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants. Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une famille nucléaire   au 3ème quartier de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Adam n’a pas fréquenté  l’école moderne pour des raisons sociales. Elle fréquenta plutôt l’école coranique qu’elle abandonna juste après avoir maîtrisé quelques sourates pour la prière. 
En vue de s’insérer dans la vie économique, Adam commença  à  mener plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus  auprès de sa grande sœur qui était une grande commerçante de Ségou. Riche de ces années expériences, elle finit par évoluer seule pour continuer la même activité que sa sœur et cela depuis 20 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété, sa force de vente est due à la qualité des marchandises et à son prix abordable.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 42 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels  tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 20 complets tissus (costumes+pantalons) pour homme au Burkina Faso. Madame Adam B. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de faire de l’embouche bovine et ovine. 
Son ambition est d’acheter un terrain nu à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Adam B. is 45 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in the 3rd district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She did not attend a modern school due to societal reasons. She instead attended a Koranic school, but she dropped out after having mastered a few suras for praying. With the aim of participating in the economy, Adam started with several revenue-generating businesses along side her older sister, who used to be a major shopkeeper of Ségou. Rich with these years of experience, she eventually advanced on her own, continuing in the same business as her sister for the past twenty years. She enjoys a large customer base and recognition. Her sales capacity is due to the quality of her merchandise and her affordable prices. With plans to increase her business capital, in order to make more profit, she turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has had an association with it for 42 months. After three solidarity loans and two individual loans, all repaid, she is now on her third individual loan. She intends to use this new loan to buy 20 men's outfits (suits with pants) in Burkina Faso. She accepts cash or credit from customers composed of women and men. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable her to fatten cattle and sheep. Her ambition is to buy a bare plot of residential land.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.

Victoria es soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Victoria tiene un salón de belleza llamado Virna, en la última semana Victoria traslado su negocio a su casa, además Victoria vende golosinas y bebidas.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vitrinas para ampliar su negocio.

Los sueños de Victoria son techar su casa y brindar una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank "Anabella." She is single, 25 years old and has a daughter. Victoria has a beauty salon called Virna; during the last week Victoria moved the business into her house. In addition, she sells sweets and drinks. Victoria needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to purchase glass display cases to expand her business. Victoria dreams of putting a new roof on her house and providing a good education to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy glass display cases to expand her business

loans.name: Rowena's Group

texts.en:
Rowena S. is from the village of Remus, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 24 years old. Rowena is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rowena is married and has 2 young children. Rowena owns and operates a livestock business, raising pigs for breeding. Rowena just started this business a few months ago.

In 2009, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 27-year-old single man who lives with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a mechanic for the past fifteen years, starting when he was very young. He used to go with his father to his mechanic’s shop and learned the occupation from him. He works hard to be able to finalize his home preparation and get married soon.

In order to develop his business and improve it, Jamal is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy additional iron to be able to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy additional iron

loans.name: Rhenos

texts.en:
Rhenos is 36 years old and married with two children who are in school. He runs a school and a retail shop to earn a living. He has been running his school for three years now and he has a good turnover due to his good customer care skills. He is married to a teacher by profession who, with her knowledge, has really supported him in running the school. He also operates a transport business to earn enough money to educate his children and support his family since the cost of living is high.  

Rhenos has been saving money with his group in Faulu Kenya called "Taifa tence" which guarantees loans for its members. His wish is to see disadvantaged children go through school and be professionals. He dreams of accomplishing this dream and also giving the children quality education in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to build another classroom.

loans.use: To build another classroom

loans.name: Nana Akua

texts.en:
Nana Akua is a trustworthy and hard-working seamstress. She is fifty-three years old and has been running her seamstress business for the past fifteen years. Akua is divorced and the mother of two children, an eighteen-year-old and a twenty-four-year-old. She always loved sewing ever since she was young because of her love for fashion and her passion to sew for others. These inclinations landed her a seamstress apprenticeship many years ago. Her favorite part of her job is cutting and shaping various designs in clothing. 

Akua currently operates her business in a rented space in a busy market. She dreams of having her own furnished shop and being able to employ additional hands so that she can take orders from corporate institutions like schools, hospitals, and offices. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of fabrics and sewing accessories like assorted thread, needles, and thimbles in bulk in order to avoid price hikes and make more money to support her family and her kids’ education through university.

loans.use: To purchase sewing accessories and fabrics

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice D. is currently in the business of selling beans and maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of pulses (groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) and soya beans to sell. Joice is 38 years old and is married to a watchman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her goods. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of pulses and soya beans to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia L. is a 38 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store. She also has 7 tricycles for rent as an additional business. She lives in Barangay Punta Tagda, Zone 5 Hinigaran, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 2 children. The children are 9 and 15 years old and are currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and tricycle rental business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP35,000.

Amelia is now borrowing PHP40,000 so that she can use the additional capital for her general store and to purchase an additional tricycle. This will be her 16th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Amelia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her general store and to purchase an additional tricycle.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Luz Marina;  ella tiene 27 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y es estudiante de enfermería, La socia tiene planes de terminar su carrera y ponerse a trabajar para ganar experiencia y después poner su propia botica, ella dice que después de todo esto ya decidirán tener un hijo con su conyugue, La socia está muy entusiasmada en terminar su carrera. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar sus estudios de enfermería. 
 
La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, el cual le permitirá seguir estudiando, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, “Arcangel Gabriel,” or Archangel Gabriel. She lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco Province in the Department of Cusco. The member is Luz Marina; she is 27-years-old and is married and is a nursing student. She plans to finish her degree and go to work to gain experience. Afterward, she would like to open her own pharmacy. She says that after all of this she may decide to have a child with her husband. She is very excited to finish her degree. She is requesting the loan to pay for her nursing studies. As a member, she values and is thankful for the loan offered through this medium which will allow her to continue studying. She commits to make the payments in the specified time.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her studies.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano M. is from the town of Talibon. He is 49 years old. Luciano is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Luciano owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling gasoline and petroleum in the local community. Luciano has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Luciano joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luciano has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Luciano is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and new items like rice, corn, sugar, etc. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Luciano from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like rice, corn, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 26 year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his family and 6 siblings. He is a relatively new business owner - he started working as a flooring worker almost three years ago.  His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to help their families with their business income. Despite his situation, he feels positive about his business potential for the coming year because during those three years, he has been able to build a good business reputation. He is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy tools for a project renovating a small building. And he will also purchase a small car to facilitate his transportation to the projects he works on. In the future, he looks forward to taking on bigger projects in his community. 
 
Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To buy tools + purchase a small car.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en: Constancia J. is a widow who lives in San Roque, Ginatilan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: vegetable vending and a general store. Constancia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Constancia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store and vegetable business so that she can continue to save up for the future and to provide her family with their monthly expenses. Constancia J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team page and become a part of our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Dionisia Consuelo

texts.es: La Sra. O. se dedica a la venta de granos básicos en el mercado la estación, inicia sus actividades laborales a las 6:00 am y las finaliza a las  4:00 pm, los créditos que le han sido otorgados por  CEPRODEL  ha logrado aumentar su inventario y así ha mejorado su vida familiar realizando mejoras en su vivienda, su núcleo familiar está conformado por 3 hijos y su esposo.
texts.en:
Mrs. O. sells basic grains in the La Estación Market. She starts her work day at 6am and ends at 4pm. CEPRODEL loans have helped her increase her stock inventory thus improving her family life by being able to make some home improvements. Her nuclear family is composed of her husband and three children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 16 y 18 años de edad, residen en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, él es agricultor dedicándose a la siembra de Maíz y Frijol desde que tenía 10 años, pues su padre también se dedico a este oficio y le enseño a don Daniel quien no tiene dificultad para desarrollar hoy día esta actividad.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono, semilla y tratamiento para cuido de plagas, porque quiere cultivar Maíz y frijol pero no cuenta con los materiales necesarios para realizar la siembra.
Este préstamo ayudara a que él pueda sembrar  y llevar la alimentación que su familia necesita.
Él sueño de don Daniel es seguir trabajando la tierra, producir más alimentos para ayudar a su familia y juntos salir adelante, también desea preparar a sus hijos y que estos terminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Daniel is 52 years old and he lives together with his wife and their two children, 16 and 18 years old. They reside in El Transito, located in San Miguel. he is an agriculturist, dedicating these past 10 years to harvesting corn and beans. His father was also an agriculturist and it was he who showed Daniel. Today Daniel has no problem in managing his business. He requests a loan to purchase fertlizer, seeds, and pesticides to ward off any plaguing insects. He wishes to harvest corn and beans but he doesn't have the materials to start the plantation. This loan will help him sow the fields and in turn, he will be able to feed his family. Daniel's dream is to keep working his fields, to produce more product and to support his family. He also wishes to prepare his children and see them achieve a university level career.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to plant corn and beans

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida es una mujer esforzada, dedicada al comercio, desde hace varios años, iniciando con dinero prestado. Lo que hoy ha venido a crecer en su negocio una pequeña pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, ha comenzado con poco, ya que todo su capital lo tenía invertido en cosméticos.
También nace la idea de alquilar un cuarto para mejorar los ingresos y poder pagar los gastos básicos en tiempo y forma y apoyar  a sus dos hijos.
Ahora con los financiamientos en Afodenic ha logrado aumentar de productos y con este préstamo, comprara granos básicos, golosinas, productos lácteos, pollo, carne con el objetivo de poder seguir creciendo en su pulpería. Lo que está contenta ya que se está  consolidando económicamente.
texts.en:
Cándida is a woman who has been dedicated to commerce for several years.  She started with borrowed money.  Now her business, a small grocery store, has grown.  She sells a variety of products.  She started with a small amount of products because all of her money was invested in cosmetics.  

She also had the idea of renting out a room to improve her income.  With the improved income she will be able to pay for the basic expenses on time and support her two children.

Now, with the loans from Afodenic, she has managed to get more products.  With this loan she will buy basic grains, sweets, dairy products, chicken, and meat.  Her objective is for her grocery store to continue growing.  

She is pleased because her financial situation is getting stronger.

loans.use: Buy various products like basic grains, sweets, dairy products, and chicken to increase her sales

loans.name: Maqbool's Group

texts.en:
Maqbool lives in Kasur, which is a small city of Pakistan and famous for its leather industry. She lives with her family in a 2 room brick house. 
She is an embroidery expert. She not only sews clothes, but also does very creative embroidery on them. Due to her work and good service to her customers, she receives regular orders. Her husband, M. L., is involved in selling bed sheets. Maqbool is the mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. She couldn’t provide education facilities to her elder children, but they now do embroidery to contribute to their family financially. Due to their financial support, Maqbool has now enrolled her two younger children to school.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy bed sheets in bulk quantity and increase his sales. Maqbool has a great confidence in her husband and his abilities. She is sure that by using his 10 years of working experience in this field, he will be able to successfully upgrade his business with this investment.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets in bulk quantity for resale.

loans.name: Silvia Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia Esperanza C. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, su negocio consiste en brindar servicio de un molino a la población de dicho municipio donde tiene 26 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Tiene un año de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado dos créditos para la compra de repuestos para el molino. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de discos, bandas, balineras y barras para el buen funcionamiento del molino.
texts.en: Mrs Silvia Esperanza C. is originally from the town of El Sauce.  Her business is providing milling services to the residents of the town.  She has been performing this service there for 26 years.  She has been working with CEPRODEL for one year and has had two loans to buy spare parts for her mill.  This loan will be used to buy discs, bands, ball-bearings and rods so that her mill works well.

loans.use: To buy discs, bands, ball-bearings and rods

loans.name: Thikaymai

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Thikaymai D..  She is married and has 3 children aged 20, 18, and 13.  In 2009, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her business.  In the future, Thikaymai plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page.     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Simon Mwangi

texts.en:
Simon, 37 years old, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eight years.  He has specialized in potatoes, which he sells to middlemen who then take them to the capital city, Nairobi.

Simon was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He cleared all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings and to hire casual workers to help him in planting. In the future, Simon hopes to start mixed farming and rear animals, starting with poultry.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings and hire casual workers to help him in planting

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two daughters. He is a farmer from Kamenka, where he grows tomatoes and radishes in two big greenhouses. Every year, Vitalyi plants at least 4,000 tall-growing tomatoes. He started this venture 10 years ago. He has already invested about 80,000 Grivnyas in this business. His annual expenses for seeds and polyethylene film amount to 15,000 Grivnyas  

Vitalyi is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase a land lot to expand his farming venture. He was planning to buy land property last summer. However, much needed remodeling in the house consumed all his savings and they couldn’t afford to buy land. Next year, Vitalyi is planning to construct a new greenhouse at the purchased land lot.

loans.use: To purchase a land lot

loans.name: Franklin Edwin

texts.es:
Franklin Edwin V. V., Es soltero vive con la tía en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. No tiene hijos.


Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Franklin Edwin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar una máquina.

Le gusta disfrutar  del deporte.
texts.en:
Franklin Edwin V. V. is single and lives with his aunt in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the UNION SAN ANTONIO community bank are located in San Antonio precinct, in San José del Tambo parish, 150 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Franklin Edwin is a farmer.  He grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  He buys his products in the Matilde Ester shopping area and sells his products in Bucay.

Franklin Edwin is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to be able to buy a car.   He enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Phoebe Cates

texts.en:
Phoebe Cates P. is from the city of Capucao Ozamiz. She is 25 years old. Phoebe Cates is single and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Phoebe Cates owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Phoebe Cates has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Phoebe Cates joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phoebe Cates is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Phoebe Cates from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en: Dionicio C.'s main source of income comes from operating a tricycle transport service. He is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Turod. Dionicio has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Dionicio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Dionicio is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle for better service

loans.name: Fabiola Rocio

texts.es: La señora Fabiola Rocio Fernández F. realiza la actividad de venta de ropa hace varios años además trabaja en un fundo Floridablanca como obrera, gracias a sus ingresos económicos a logrado una buena acumulación de bienes. Solicitante requiere del crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que comienza la campaña escolar, requiere comprar uniformes, zapatos de colegio y otras cosas más. Se propone acceder al crédito por que presenta buen record crediticio en otros Bancos.
texts.en:
Sra. Fabiola Rocio Fernández F. has been selling clothes for several years. She also works at the Florida Blanca Estate as a farm worker. Thanks to her earnings, she has been able build up assets.

Fabiola is requesting a loan to invest in her business since the school year is starting. She needs to buy uniforms, school shoes, and other items. Fabiola is being recommended for this loan because she has a good credit record with other banks.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy uniforms, school schools, and other items

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en: Melchorita is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a furniture-making  and a food vending business. She lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000. Melchorita is borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she could buy materials for her furniture-making business. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Melchorita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To buy materials for her furniture business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth P., from Calabayan Ozamiz City, is 36 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, for over 10 years Janeth has owned and operated a general store selling a variety of products in the local community, earning approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Janeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles, bread, biscuits and candies to sell. This will be Janeth's fourth loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, bread, biscuits and candies

loans.name: Jane Mary Ndinda

texts.en:
Jane is married and has three children. Her primary business is selling cosmetics and she has been in this business for two years, earning an income of Ksh 8,100 per month. Jane's business is near the market and thus every day she has clients.

Jane was introduced to KADET by existing clients and she is servicing her first loan which she plans to use to buy more lotions, sanitary wares, towels and hair extensions. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and feed her family. 

Jane hopes to be stable so as to sustain her business. She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: to buy lotions, sanitary wares, towels and hair extensions for her salon.

loans.name: Marthen

texts.en:
Marthen is a 39-year-old entrepreneur. He lives in Oebufu Village, Kupang City. Marthen is married to Rince, a 38-year-old lady, and they have four children. The children are 	Astriana, 12 years old, who is in the sixth grade of elementary school; Yoprianus, 9 years old, who is in the fourth grade of elementary school; Aldi, 5 years old, who is in kindergarten, and Deni, 3 years old, who is not at school yet.
 
Marthen has a kiosk business that helps him in supporting his family. Even so, the income is not sufficient to fully meet his family needs. As Marthen is the only income source for his family, he also sells agricultural products in the market. He buys the agricultural products from the farmers and resells it at the market. Marthen sells vegetables, potatoes, cassava, sweet potatoes, pineapples and bananas. 

Due to the limited capital that he has, Marthen cannot buy agricultural products in bulk to resell.

Marthen dreams of developing a small building next to his kiosk to sell the crops. He will be happy because then he will not need to sell the vegetable in the market. He also wishes that he could buy agricultural products at bulk prices.
 
To make his dream come true, Marthen is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He plans to spend the loan to buy more vegetables and to develop a small building to sell vegetables. He is hoping that TLM will help him in making his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and to develop a small building to sell vegetables

loans.name: 3 De Septiembre (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal 3 de Septiembre. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, el comercio en general, prestan servicios como cabinas telefónicas y salones de belleza. Unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer crédito y esperan seguir por mucho tiempo en el Banco Comunal.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nelly S., tiene 28 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y de 2 años de vedad, la mayor  estudia en escuela. El marido es guardia de seguridad.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de  productos para el hogar (planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, camas, etc.), de zapatos y zapatillas por catalogo. Ella enseña la revista donde están todos estos artículos y sus clientes deciden que es lo que quieren comprar, luego ella realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos de acuerdo al número que tengan sus clientes, realiza los cobros cada ocho días. Nos cuenta que lleva 4 años realizando esta labor y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, camas, sandalias y zapatos. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Los Angeles in the community of Colon of the city of Portoviejo the members of the communal bank named "3 de Septiembre" meet every two weeks. They have various types of businesses including agriculture, general store, and services such as telephone booths and beauty salons. They joined their efforts to have the ability to access loans from Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner). This is their first loan and they hope to keep their communal bank going for a long time.

Here we meet Mrs. Nelly S.. She is 28 years old, married common-law, and she has two children, aged 10 and 2 years old. The eldest is in school. Her husband is a security guard.

She is a very good house wife and she sells various household products (irons, blenders, fans, beds, etc) and she also sells shoes by catalogue. She displays the catalogue where these articles are pictured and her clients decide what it is they would like to purchase. She then places her orders and she later delivers the products according to the number assigned to her clients. She takes payments every week. She says that she has 4 years in the business and it has been very successful. 

This loan will be used to purchase irons, blenders, fans, beds, sandals, and shoes. This is her first loan cycle with her communal bank,

Her dream is to have a well built house, as her current house is made of canes.

loans.use: to purchase irons, blenders, fans, beds, sandals and shoes.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba W. A. sells kenkey, which is a Ghanaian staple made from corn, in Amoanda near Elmina. She is divorced and has two children. Her ex-husband assists her in taking care of their children even though they are divorced. She is eager to increase the quantity of kenkey produced as her customers are increasing. Her loan will be used to buy maize to expand her kenkey business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy maize to expand her kenkey (a Ghanaian staple made from corn) business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella trabaja con el material de cueros, ella hace trabajos en cuero como colchas, llamas y vicuñas y luego los vende llevando a lugares como Juliaca y Sicuani, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de trabajos  en cuero. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuero de distintos colores.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana, 49, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and three children.  She alternates her daily chores with the sale of crafts.  She works with animal pelts.  She makes items out of llama and vicuña leather like bedspreads that she then takes to places like Juliaca and Sicuani to sell.  This method of work allows her to support her children.  She wants to enlarge and improve her business of leather sales and is asking for a loan to buy pelts in assorted colors.

She is happy about the loan and committed to repay.

loans.use: to buy animal pelts in assorted colors.

loans.name: Meliton

texts.es: Melitón, de 32 años reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí conformó su familia junto a Yesenia, su esposa; a la que quiere y con la que vive en una casa alquilada. Como buen hombre del campo, se dedica a “la agricultura”, principal actividad familiar y económica del lugar. En sus 3 años de experiencia en producir la tierra, logró obtener muchas cosas: entre ellas un terreno propio de 3 hectáreas de extensión, en los que siembra café y plátano. Todos los días desde las primeras horas de la mañana trabaja en el buen cuidado de sus sembríos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Él vende sus productos en el mercado de La Merced puesto que es donde mejor le pagan bien; pero en temporadas de campaña agrícola comercializa el café a la cooperativa de la comunidad Sanchirio del Palomar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Por otro lado se dedica al trabajo como peón en otros terrenos agrícolas, donde le pagan un dinero extra por los cuidados que brinda a dichos cultivos. En adelante, espera ahorrar el dinero necesario para poder comprar su propia casa. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo financiero para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Melitón de adquirir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizante natural (guano de isla), para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café y plátano.
texts.en:
Melitón, 32, lives in the Palomar community (central Peruvian jungle) in a rented house with his wife, Yesenia.  As any good man living in the country he is dedicated to farming, which is his main source of income, like many in the area.  For three years he has been working the land and obtained many things, among which is his own 3-acre patch of land on which he grows coffee and bananas.  Everyday he works from the early morning hours taking care of his crops because he knows the money he gets for his produce will depend on harvest quality.  He sells his crops in the La Merced market which is where he gets the most money.  During coffee season he sells his product to a co-op in the Sanchirio del Palomar community.

What he enjoys most about his work is harvest time, when he can reap the fruits of his months of hard work.  He also works as a farm laborer on other farms, where they pay him extra for the care he gives to crops.  In the future he hopes to be able to save enough money to buy a house.  He is a member of the communal bank "AROMA DE CAFÉ" and this is his third loan through MFP.  He hopes this financial support will help him meet his goals.  He is committed to paying it back on time, as he has done previously.  He enjoys being part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  If Melitón receives your support he will invest the money in several sacks of organic and natural fertilizer (called "guano de isla"), to use on his coffee and banana crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 30 лет. Он Женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Дилшод имеет высшее образование, он экономист. По профессии он проработал один год. На сегодняшний день Дилшод занимается торговлей на рынке "Мубориз". Он арендует торговую точку, где продает детскую одежду. Он привозит товар с города Душанбе. В этой области он уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Dilshod lives in Gissar. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. Dilshod has a higher education; he is an economist. He worked in his profession for one year.  Now, Dilshod trades in Muboriz market.  He rents a shop where he sells children's clothes. He brings the goods in from Dushanbe. He has been doing this work for ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods.

loans.name: Milton José

texts.es:
El señor Milton José  vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua trabaja en la misma cuidad.
Don Milton  visito nuestra oficina para solicitar crédito ya que necesita el dinero para hacerles mejoras a la  vivienda.
El préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, piedra, bloque, cemento
Y el pago de mano de obra.
Don José  agrádese a ceprodel por los créditos obtenido
texts.en: Milton José lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua, and works in the same city. Milton visited the office to request a loan, since he needs the money to make improvements to his home. He will invest the funds from the loan in buying construction materials such as sand, stone, concrete blocks and cement, and paying for labor.  Milton José is grateful to Ceprodel for the loans he has obtained.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 64 years old and has been in farming for 22 years in his home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. His farm currently produces maize, beans and milk which are all sold to the local market. He gets additional income from his pension.

Raphael has made a loan request of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter (machine that cuts corn stalks or hay into smaller pieces for cattle feed) for his dairy farming business. Raphael has made a record with this being his seventh loan request with Juhudi Kilimo and he says the loans have helped him educate his children who number 10 (but with only two now in school).

Raphael notes that the dairy industry is currently experiencing stiff competition thereby making the price too low for the farmers. He is very happy with Juhudi Kilimo for transforming his life and that of his children.

loans.use: to purchase a chuff cutter for his dairy farming.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Joy requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fabric for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 28 years old and married with four children. She has been operating a grocery store for five years. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for giving her a loan which she used as capital to start her business.  
Naomi hopes to grow her business into a wholesale business in the future. She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a hard-working 58 year-old business man. He is married and blessed with a 28 years old child. For more than ten years now, he has been operating a general shop so as to make a living. He makes an extra shilling from the rent he collects from his rental houses and the earnings from supplying milk. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have expanded his business and increased his clientele. He is requesting a loan of 60000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, salt and utensils. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to make wise investments and to plan and budget his finances.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, salt and utensils

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with 7 children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past 2 years, she has operated a grocery shop.  She sells to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her grocery shop to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs.30,000, she wants to purchase grocery items, sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables and onions in order to increase her stock.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables and onions

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a married man with two children aged 17 and 9. He is from Surallah, South Cotabato where he has a farming business. Roberto grows rice and vegetables on his land. He works hard to improve his harvest and income.

Roberto has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. He hopes for this loan to help improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 40 years old, 2 children who are in school and other two are working to help the family.

Marites has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment.

Marites has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Maitiro Group

texts.en:
Ritha is a 48-year-old widow who lives in Shurugwi with her six children aged 29, 27, 26, 23, 19 and 10. Only two of her children are still in school. She operates in the local market where she buys and sells shoes, blankets and clothes. 

She lacks funds to continue her business. She has a loan of $400.00 which she used to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. If her business goes well, she is looking forward to a have a clothing shop in Chachacha (a shopping centre in Shurugwi) and also will be in a position to send her four grand children to school.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 34-year-old single man who has been fixing cars and doing electrical work on trucks for 22 years. Fadel was very young when he started working; he had to help his parents earn a living. He didn’t get to live his childhood as it was supposed to be, so he is working hard to plan for his future.

Fadel's 22 years in the auto repair business have given him broad experience as well as customers' trust. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a special scanner to detect cars' hidden problems and to make needed changes to his house such as putting on new tiles to make it suitable for healthy living.

Fadel is a man with a very good reputation. He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future by opening a big garage that is capable of handling all vehicle needs and where he can provide special customer care.

loans.use: To buy a special car scanner and made needed changes to his house

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga is 25 years old, and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife is taking a kindergarden teacher training, and his daughter goes to the kindergarden. He started his meat retailing business in 2008. Now his meat products range has expanded and he sells flour as well. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "My goal is to support my family." He is requesting MNT 1,400,000 to buy meat before winter, when the price gets high.

loans.use: To buy meat before winter, when the price gets high.

loans.name: Shirley Giancarla

texts.es:
Shirley es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca” del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.  En la actualidad la señora sigue estudiando.

Se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales, su primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un ciclo.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de Napol, Noni, una docena de Jarabe de coca, éstos productos los vende en las ferias de la zona.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su empresa financiera, una casa y carro propio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Shirley is a member of the “Kapia Marca” communal bank in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 20 years old, single and has a son.  She is still pursuing her studies.

She sells medicinal products.  Her first, 500 new sol, loan was invested in her business.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one cycle.

She will ask for a new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy Napol, Noni and a dozen coca syrups; she sells these products in the local street markets.

Her dream for the future is to have a financial firm, a house and a car of her own.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the ease of the loan.

loans.use: to buy Napol, Noni and one dozen coca syrup.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tashana

texts.en:
Tashana is 63 years old and married with seven children. She runs a general store in the Philippines, working hard to provide for her family. She has been running her store for five years and also earns income from vending food.

Tashana has borrowed and paid off nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Tashana aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Angela Santos

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

La señora Ángela es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en él ha recibido mucha ayuda y alegrías ya que se entretienen cada reunión del banco, tiene  66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 16 hijos, todos mayores de edad,  pero dos hijas que están solteras aún viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que nunca se ha cansado de trabajar, trabaja en una empresa de sardinas de la localidad lugar en el cual lleva más de 30 años, pero además de esto en su casa tiene un bar en el cual vende bocadillos y bebidas como jugos naturales, batidos de fruta, energizantes, entre otras cosas, allí en este negocio le ayudan sus hijas, con las que trabaja todos los días  desde las 18h00 hasta las 22h00 ya que en la empresa trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 a 16h00, ella lleva más de 11 años con su negocio y le va muy bien, empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres, frutas y energizantes.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Honduras 2000 meets twice a month in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this beautiful place. Here most of the people are very hard workers involved in maritime pursuits.

Angela is a founding member of the Community Bank and she likes it because she has received a lot of help and happiness as they have fun at each meeting. She is 66 years old, married and has 16 children. All of them are adults but she has two unmarried daughters living in her home. Her husband is a fisherman. 

She is a fighting woman who has never tired of work. She has been working in a sardine company in her hometown for more than 30 years, but besides this she has a stand where she sells snacks and drinks such as natural juices, smoothies, energy drinks, and other things. Her daughters help her with this business. She works every day from 6:00PM until 10:00PM in her stand and she works Monday through Friday from 8:00AM until 4:00PM at the sardine company. She has been in business for 11 years and things are going very well. She began her business with the first loan that she received from the communal bank.

She will use the money from this loan to buy groceries, fruits, and energy drinks.

Her dreams are to have good health and to carry on.

loans.use: to buy groceries, fruit, and energy drinks

loans.name: Les Jardinieres Group

texts.fr:
Mme NATHALIE est la représentante du groupe LES JARDINIERES. Elle est  mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le moins âge 06mois. 01 va  à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes  en charge.

Elle est tisseuse  depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  marché de pissy en ville. Ses clients sont  les Hommes et les Femmes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01balles de fils et 1/2kg de teintures.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de pagnes tissés.
texts.en:
Nathalie is the representative of the Les Jardinières group. She is married and mother to three children. The eldest child is eight years old and the youngest six months. One of the children goes to school. Nathalie has five dependents.

Nathalie has been a weaver for the past three years and she gets her supplies in the town of Pissy. Her customers are both men and women. She wants to buy a bale of thread and half a kilo of dyes. 

She uses her profits to boost her business and her ambition is to open a large shop selling woven "pagnes" (pieces of decorative West African fabric).

loans.use: to buy one bale of thread and half a kilogram of dyes

loans.name: Achut

texts.en:
Achut is a 29-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Achut is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 42 years old and lives in Tukuran ZDS. She is married and has three children.

Jennifer has a shop that sells food. She has had this business for 13 years. She request a loan to have a extra capital for her store.

Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Jennifer hopes to have a new store.

loans.use: to have capital for her food stall.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is one of those young smallholder farmers who are determined and are not limited by their age. He is an ever smiling youthful 22-year-old farmer from Endebes, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Paul is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his parents and siblings as a primary source of income. The living conditions in the Endebes, Kitale area are very tough and one needs to have tough skin in order to survive. Paul has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. 

Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Paul started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past 3 years. Paul's sources of income are from producing vegetables, maize, and eggs. These products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, which is a problem for Paul. The Endebes area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. 

Paul with great humility is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Paul is very determined to succeed, and because he is much disciplined with finances, he plans to accumulate profits to provide a secure future for himself and for his parents and siblings. Paul's dream is to provide a secure future for his siblings. Through your loan you will help him realize his dream.

Paul promises to make his payments punctually and is thankful to all those who will support him in acquiring the motorbike, all he can tell them is "Thank You".

loans.use: to buy a motorbike, for the speedy transportation of his farm produce to market.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro sells one of the most popular foods in Ecuador, crab (cangrejo in Spanish). The crabs he sells, which are in the picture, are found in mangroves along the coast of Guayaquil. His father taught him how to catch these animals when he was 9 years old and he has been doing so ever since. Due to the unfortunate and strenuous economic situation his parents faced, Pedro did not go to school past the third grade. He cannot read and write, but out of the necessities of his job he has become good at math.
