Pedro no longer catches the animals himself to sell, instead he purchases them from wholesale distributors.

He needs the loan in order to purchase larger quantities of crab. The holiday season is a great time to sell because people have dinners known as “cangrejadas” where family and friends sit around a large table and break open crabs while talking and listening to music.

This business plays a major role in the life of Pedro. He has 5 children, although two of them are already independent. His two grown children work with Pedro and also lack a formal education. Pedro hopes that with the extra profits from this business he will be able to fix up his home. Currently it is made out of a bamboo like wood and is situated near the coast where the tide often brings in water to his house.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He needs the loan in order to purchase larger quantities of crab

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is in a polygamous marriage and has seven children. Lessons learned from the death of her daughter and father within one week, and the experience of being unable to pay for a blood transfusion for a critically ill member of her family are sources of her motivation to become economically independent. With her two previous loans, she provided her community with mobile restaurant services and food crops.

Given a loan of $400, Regina plans to buy 60 liters of palm oil, 5 bags of rice, 5 piglets, and seedlings (yam, maize, groundnuts, and beans.) She also needs to pay labor costs for the clearing of her fields. Besides being in this business for more than two years, she is a good cook and people like eating her food. With her determination and her fertile piece of land, she is convinced she will succeed.

She plans to repay her loan in 18 months. The first installment shall be due in the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Selling food and growing crops and pigs

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun Y., 47 years old, has six children and lives in Kampongcham province, Cambodia. She works on her farm growing crops and feeding animals, and usually earns around $7/day in revenue with her husband, who runs a business by driving a horse-cart to transport passengers in this village. A horse-cart taxi is very common and more popular than motor-taxi or Tuk Tuk because it is very cheap and the inhabitants can afford traveling to and from the market. 
Soeun Y. is looking for a $500 loan to buy a horse in order to run a business, and to purchase some seeds for her farm. 
In the future, this couple hopes to buy another piece of land to increase their crops and animals.

loans.use: To purchase a horse to run a business.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.en:
Odiljon S. is 30 years old, and he has a secondary-level education. He is married and has 1 child. Odiljon grew up in a poor family, and his parents could not pay for his education, so he does not have any specialization. After his school graduation, he went to a market and provided his help as a loader. Everyday he saw how the sellers worked successful and earned income.

He decided to start his own business but did not have any money. Four years ago he started a small business, and first goods he sold were were men's socks. Gradually he learned skills in selling, and he increased the range of goods and turnover. Currently Odiljon sells kids' sport wear and men's underwear. With the loan amount of $575, Odiljon is going to buy a new range of kids' and men's clothes at lower prices than other sellers. This loan helps a poor person obtain goods at moderate prices. He is going to pay off the loan over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy and sell a new range of goods

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria and her husband have a seven year old boy. They repair bicycles at a small space that they have set up in their rented apartment.

They both wake up early every day in order to attend to their clients. They have a very high demand because most of the people in their area use the bicycle as their main transportation method.

Their repair tools have started to show imperfections and the workshop looks smaller every time.

This is why Maria wants to extend her workshop and acquire more tools to improve their services. She requests for a $275 dollar loan which she compromises to repay within 6 months, in order to start the project and to be able to give their son a better quality of life. Maria and her family look forward to your generous help.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

María y su esposo tienen un niño de 7 años y desempeñan su trabajo diario en un espacio que acondicionaron para reparar bicicletas en un domicilio alquilado hace ya varios años. Todos los días desde muy temprano ambos se preparan para atender a sus clientes; la demanda que tienen es muy alta debido a que la mayoría de las personas en esta localidad utilizan estas herramientas para desplazarse de un lugar a otro. Los instrumentos que utilizan para realizar las reparaciones están presentando desperfectos hace poco y el espacio en el que desempeñan esta labor cada vez se ve más pequeño. Por esta razón María desea ampliar el espacio en el que se encuentra el taller y adquirir nuevas herramientas para mejorar el servicio que ofrece. Su solicitud es por un monto de 275 dólares que se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses a fin de iniciar su proyecto y poder brindarle con los ingresos que genere esta actividad una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. María y su familia esperan tu generosa ayuda.

loans.use: More tools and better distribution for Maria's workshop

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a single mother of two, a nine-year-old daughter and a twenty-year-old son. She makes a living by renting out rooms in her house, and she also owns a taxi that her son drives.

Jacinta has recently developed very severe and painful arthritis, which makes it difficult for her to take care of her guests in the rooms she rents. Jacinta has found an electromagnetic treatment for her arthritis, but it is very expensive and she has to pay for the treatment out of her own pocket. This loan will go towards Jacinta’s treatment, which will enable her to continue working to support her family.

loans.use: pay for arthritis treatment

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 56-year-old married mother of six children. She lives with her husband in Rongo, Kenya. She started her cereal business in 2002. She purchases cereal, such as maize, beans, millet, ground nuts, and green grams, in bulk during harvest season when prices are low and sells to the consumers when prices go up.

Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation, and many years in business coupled with a well-established customer base ensure that her business will continue to grow despite stiff competition. She has applied for a loan of US $ 1000 to purchase in more cereal in bulk to add to her inventory, and save some to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

loans.use: Puchase cereal to sell

loans.name: Thi Bac

texts.vi:
Beside tending on her small animal husbandry, Ms Bắc also sells vegetables at the market to be able to put her 4 children in school. She applies to Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) for a loan of 2006000 VND (150 USD). She plans to use the loan to expand her business thus increase her income & improve her family living condition.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Ngoài chăn nuôi, cô Bắc còn đi chợ bán cau để có thể nuôi 4 người con đang đi học. Với số tiền 2006000 vay từ Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binh minh cdc, cô hy vọng có mở rộng hoạt động kinh doanh của mình, tăng thu nhập, cải thiện đời sống gia đình.

loans.use: Buy vegetables for sales

loans.name: Nangwe Madibira (Vii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Saada N.. She is currently in the business of selling dry fish and is requesting a loan to add in fish business. Saada is 49 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 10 and 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Saada makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to help her husband with the construction of their new house Saada has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Saada is joined in her small group by Shamim N., Saida N., Kedi D., and Marita M.. Shamim N. has a business in selling used clothes and wants to increase the stock of clothes. Saida N. is currently operating a used clothing and wants a loan to add in clothe business. Kedi D. operates a business of hardware and wants to expand hardware shop by adding in stock. Marita M. is currently in the business of hardware shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock.

loans.use: To add in fish business

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.en:
Corazón D. Jesús is a small community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project. The bank provides credit and educational services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations because it's a cold and very mountainous area (with altituD. ranges from 6,000-17,000 feet above sea level), it's difficult to grow crops there, and it lacks an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR Corazón D. Jesús is located the community of Soccos in the Anco district of Churcampa province. The population's main activities are growing either corn (lower altitudes) or potatoes and wheat (higher altitudes), and raising guinea-pigs, pigs, and chicken. Soccos faces many difficulties due to its remoteness, lack of public transportation, and access to markets, and receives very few public and social services.

The bank has completed its first loan cycle in just half a year of existence. A total of 3,600 soles (about $1,240.00) has been loaned to nine women. The loans range from 100, 200, 400, and 600 soles and, in one case, 1,000 soles. The group was also able to save over 1,700 soles (about $590.00) in this first cycle and will continue to save in the future.

During their first cycle, the members have learned to love and value themselves as people. They have learned–sometimes for the first time in their lives–to save, and have received some training about how to improve the quality of their lives. Most members have small grocery stores or sell at local weekly markets, but every member has a different testimony.

Dora Z. D. C. runs a small grocery store and also sells ice-cream. With her loan of 600 soles, she will buy new supplies for the store. When asked about her future, she says that she wants to improve her small store and that everything she earns and saves is for the education of her children so they can keep studying and become professionals. She is saving to buy a glass showcase for her products and more items to sell.

María Soledad Q. M. buys and sells fruit at small, local weekly markets. She also has a small field where she produces pacay, oranges, and lime-fruits. And, if it's not enough, she buys and sells tara and cochinilla, which she takes to the markets as well. With her loan of 600 soles she will be able to buy more fruit to sell. With her savings she wants to improve her business, send her children to school, and make improvements to her house.

Lucia S. S. has the smallest loan of the group (100 soles) and runs a small business buying and selling animals like pigs. Sometimes she sells the meat of cows or bulls in Soccos or one of the local fairs. She also has some terrain where she cultivates corn, potatoes, wheat, barley, and olluco. But most of the production is for auto-consumption. Lucia’s dream for the future is to buy a bull (improved) to use to raise cows. And, like all the women, her dream is for her family--to improve their quality of life and for her children to go to school. She will use her savings to buy school supplies because a new year is starting. Lucia says she has also learned some specific things in FINCA. She learned to say sorry and not fight over small issues, she learned not to gossip, not talk badly of someone, and to be more calm when talking with her husband and children.

loans.use: To buy new supllies

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi A. is a typical businesswoman. With her combination of businesses, she has being able to win customers. She sells kerosene, snacks and cooked food. At 46 years of age with one child, she is dedicated to her business. She acquired the skill for 2 years and has been in this business for the past 5 years. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Oluwakemi needs the sum of $875 to enable her buy more kerosene for sale. This she says will enable her to improve her business. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene, snacks and food Items

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Mr. Pedro R. is a hardworking gentleman who from a young age has acquired vast experience in the agricultural business. Today, it is his only source of income with which he supports his family. He currently has a small farm which he cultivates at the right moment and also raises cattle, providing pasture for them to feed on. It is important to stress that this job requires a lot of dedication, which is why this gentleman works hard in order to improve his family’s living conditions.

He is currently in need of purchasing calves to raise. For this reason, he is seeking the help of Ceprodel so that he can obtain a loan that will allow him to buy the calves and make the most use of them, selling milk or other cow-derived products. It is important to note that he has a history of two loans with Ceprodel, which were paid on time and according to the guidelines specified by this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Pedro R. es un caballero muy esforzado que desde muy joven adquirió basta experiencia en el negocio agropecuario y hoy en día se dedica a este negocio siendo su único ingreso para mantener a su familia. Actualmente cuenta con su pequeña finca donde prepara las condiciones para la siembra cuando esto es necesario y de igual manera prepara las condiciones para la crianza de las vaquillas seleccionando el pasto para su respectiva alimentación. Es de mucha necesidad destacar que este trabajo requiere de muchísima disposición y por eso es que este caballero se esfuerza fuertemente para mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.

Hoy en día la necesidad que él atraviesa es la compra de terneros para su desarrollo. Por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita la compra de estos animales para sacarle el máximo provecho y así comercializar ya sea la leche o el resto de sus productos derivados. Es necesario destacar que actualmente tiene un record de dos créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido con la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba S. sells fish. She is a single mother, and her income is not sufficient for Araba and her seven children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther is married and lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood of the town of Concha. She is 35 years old and has two children, who are 3 and 7 years old. Her husband works as a driver and they both work hard to help their family get by. Maria Esther has a small business selling ornamental plants.

She has been in this business for 20 years. She grows the plants herself and then sells them to her customers. She sells flowers and green plants. She will use the loan to buy new species of plants and good soil so that she can offer new products and also increase her inventory.

Her immediate plans are to help her family get ahead and improve their living conditions. She hopes to do this by increasing her sales, which would be accomplished by offering new plants.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Esther es casada, habita en el barrio San Caralampio del municipio de la Concha, tiene 35 años de edad y dos niños de 3 y 7 años de edad. Su esposo desempeña como conductor y ambos llevan a cuestas la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus familia. Maria esther es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la plantación y ventas de productos ornamentales. Desde hace veinte años está en el negocio de comercio de plantas, ella misma cultiva sus plantas y después las vende a sus clientes. Vende Flores y Plantas Verdes. El dinero lo utilizará en la adquisisción de nuevas especies de plantas y tierra abonada para poder ofrecer nuevos productos y así mismo incrementar el inventario de su negocio. Sus planes inmediatos son poder sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida y espera poder hacerlo através del incremento de sus ventas, y que será debido a la oferta de nuevos productos de plantas.

loans.use: To buy plants and soil so she can create new products for her business

loans.name: Silvanus

texts.en: Silvanus M. is a Tanzanian carpenter. He makes a variety of home and school furniture. He has been in the business for two years now. His customers are schools and home users. He needs a loan of  $550 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Née le 14 novembre 1994 à Mission Tové dans la préfecture de Zio, dame D. Akouvi s’est mariée à un cultivateur et a quatre (4) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits de premières nécessités à coté du cafeteria le secret. Elle aide beaucoup son mari dans les dépenses de la famille telles que le loyer, les frais de scolarités etc. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de 6 sacs de sucre, 5  sacs de riz, 4 bidons d’huile et 5 cartons de savons.
texts.en:
Born November 14, 1994, in Mission Tové in the prefecture of Zio, Mrs. Akouvi D. is married to a farmer and has four children. She sells products of daily necessity next to the cafeteria Le Secret. She helps her husband a lot with family expenses, such as the rent, school costs, etc.

This first loan that she seeks will allow her to stock up by purchasing 6 bags of sugar, 5 bags of rice, 4 cans of oil, and 5 boxes of soap.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy daily necessity products

loans.name: Inshallah

texts.en: Inshallah was born in 1948. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and settled in the Fuzuli region in Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married and has 4 children. Five years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $500 to buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Ni Komang Sunistri

texts.id:
Ni Komang Sunistri masih tetap berharap dari usaha ternak  ayam kampung  yang sudah lama ditekuni. Periode   terdahulu Ni Komang Sunistri mengalami kerugian karena pada saat itu terjadi musibah penyakit Flu Burung sehingga penghasilan maupun pemasaran ayam dan telornya kurang maksimal. Segala upaya sudah dicoba untuk menangkal terjangkitnya virus itu, baik penyemprotan maupun penyuntikan. Hasilnya pun masih belum maksimal.
Untuk periode ke II dana Pinjaman dari Yayasan DINARI dipakai untuk memperbaiki usaha beternak ayamnya yang sudah ditekuni. Karena kandang sudah ayam sudah ada dana dipakai untuk menambah  jumlah ayam yang sudah mulai produktif menghasilkan telor dan untuk biaya pakan. Pakan ayam terdiri dedak padi, jagung dan konsetrat. Hasil penjulan telor dalam sehari dapat mencapai Rp. 500.000,- Harga telur per butir Rp. 1.000.- Keuntungan per butir Rp. 100.- Jadi penjualan Rp. 500.000.- Ni Komang Sunistri mendapat keuntungan Rp. 50.000,- Dari keuntungan inilah Ni Komang Sunistri dapat membantu penghasilan suaminya dan dapat membiayai kedua anaknya.
texts.en:
Ni Komang Sunistri is in the business of raising chicken (poultry farming). In the last loan period, she experienced a loss due to the avian flu that impacted her business.

In this 2nd loan period, she wants to use the loan money to rebuild her poultry business. She uses the money to buy more chickens so she can get more eggs. She also spends the money to buy poultry food.

She can earn IDR 500 thousand per day (around USD 52/ day) from selling eggs. From this she can earn a net profit of IDR 50 thousand (USD 5.2/ day). With this she can help to ease her husband's economic burden and also to raise their two children.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken and to fix the cage (Membeli anak ayam dan memperbaiki kandang)

loans.name: Danch

texts.en:
Danch S. is 24 years old, married and operates a motor-taxi service around the market near his house. He earns on average US$3 a day. His wife, Chen Mala is 18 years old. She operates a beauty salon from their home and also designs and makes wedding cloths. The couple takes care of Chen's mother. 

Danch S. is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a newer motorbike to operate his motor-taxi service and the rest will be used for utility expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen H., 31, is a pig breeder and resides with three of her children and her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She typically makes $2 US a day while her husband has a business purchasing and selling yams in the village. On average, he makes $5 US a day.

Sen H. would like to take out a loan of $1000 US to expand yams stock by purchasing more yams from the grower.

loans.use: To purchase yams for sale.

loans.name: Delcy Roxana

texts.es:
Con la inauguracion de un nuevo supermecrado ubicado allado de su antiguo trabajo, Delcy decidió dejar su negocio de venta de frutas en unmercado que ya tenia diez años. La competencia era muy grande y el costo del alquiler del local ya nole era rentable.

Por ello, hace cuatro años abrió una bodega en su casa. Hoy en dia este negocio ha crecido y recibe la visita de muchos clientes, a pesar de que la ubicación no es tan buena. Gracias a su trabajo durante todos estos años ella ha mantenido a su hogar y a sus dos hijos.

En un futuro Delcy quisiera abrir una tienda en provincia para poder estarallado de supareja quientrabaja en un centro minero alinterior del país.
texts.en:
With the opening of a new supermarket located near her old work, Delcy decided to leave her fruit sale business in a market that was already ten years old. The competition was large, and the cost to rent the space was not profitable. Because of this, four years ago she opened a grocery store in her house. Nowadays, her business has grown and receives traffic from many clients in spite of its poor location. Thanks to her work all these years, she has maintained her home and supported her two children. In the future, Delcy wants to open a store in a different province in order to be able to be near her spouse, who is working in a mining center in the center of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La inversion de su tienda

loans.name: Chhouem

texts.en:
Chhouem H. was born in 1950 and he currently lives in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He is married to Mrs. Morm, who is 46 years old; his wife generates income by raising pigs in a stall next to their house. The couple has two children (one is married while the other is single), both of whom are employed.

To earn a living, he grows vegetables, but he also owns and operates a rice mill machine out of his house (i.e., he provides a rice-hulling service). H. is seeking a loan for the benefit of his wife's business; specifically, she would use the capital infusion to buy more food for her pigs in order to fatten them.

loans.use: To fatten pigs by purchasing additional pig food

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is a member of Paglaum under the microfinance program. She has two children, and both of them are still in elementary school. Leizel and her husband are engaged in fishing. They have a "bunsod", a kind of fish cage, where all of the fish might be trapped, once they are inside the "bunsod".

A bunsod is one of the best fishing strategies especially if the season is good and many fish arise. They acquired a bunsod from her parents-in-law with whom they are living, as they don't yet have their own home for the family. That's why they are requesting a PHP 5,000 loan for said project.

Leizel has high hopes of adding a number of fish cages so they can increase their family income. She strives also so she can send her two kids to school and have them finish their chosen courses in the future.

loans.use: For purchase of shells and other aquamarine products

loans.name: Marfa

texts.en:
Marfa is married with a grown son. She sells retail items in the central market of Novomoskovsk, eastern Ukraine. Marfa has been in this business for 15 years. Currently, her net profit is over 4,000 Grivnas a month.

Marfa’s business is constantly growing. One of the advantages she has in the competitive market is affordable prices and regular inventory additions. Her little vending kiosk is very popular in the marketplace where she works. Marfa realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business as loans allow her to increase her turnover and expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 6,200 Grivnas. One of Marfa’s further plans is to continue expanding her trade and eventually generate enough profit to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena A. is a 38-year-old woman who has dedicated her life to her three sons. Rena`s main business is livestock breeding. After finishing school, she got married and did not have any chance to work or study because, all her life, she was looking after children. But in 1996 when her husband lost his job, she offered to start their own business.

With a loan from AqroInvest, Rena and her family started breeding livestock. Now that Rena's son is entering the university, she needs more income to pay for his education. For this purpose, Rena has applied for $1200 USD loan to purchase two calves and increase her income. Rena has a good client history and, with your help and generosity, we would be proud to support this hardworking woman.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастурахон работает медицинской сестрой в центре здоровья джамоата Хонобод, что расположен в Исфаринском районе. Каждый день 5 дней в неделю с утра до вечера она работает, а по выходным дням работает у себя в огороде дома. Мастурахон 37 лет, замужем и имеет 3 детей. Муж работает в колхозе. Дополнительно к своим занятиям супруги занимаются откормом скота. Сейчас у них 2 коровы и 1 бычок. Откорм скота приносит супругам основную часть дохода семьи, так как молоко получаемое от коров частью используется в питании семьи а излишки продают соседям, а бычки после прироста продаются на рынке. Дополнительно к скоту, имеющемуся дома, Мастурахон хочет приобрести еще одного бычка, и поэтому подала заявку на займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
Mastura works as a nurse a health center in the Khonabad municipality. She works from morning to night every day, five days per week and spends weekends working on her home garden. Mastura is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband works at a collective farm. In addition to their jobs, the husband and wife are involved in livestock feeding. They currently own 2 cows and 1 bull. Cattle feeding business is the primary income source for the family because milk is either used in the family’s diet or sold to neighbors, and bulls, once grown, are sold at a market. Mastura wants to purchase one more bull in addition to the cattle they own at home. This is why she requested this loan from Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Ndekeleni

texts.en:
Ndekeleni is married and has two children, ages 6 and 2. She owns a small charcoal store and sells fish in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Hatuyumbi loan group (Group code 201979) and currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $330. Each day, she works at her business for 12 hours.  

Ndekeleni is now requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania, so that she is able to buy more charcoal and fish for re-sale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase, and she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and fish for re-sale

loans.name: Bernarda De La Concepcion

texts.es: Bernarda de la Concepción A. tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Su esposo labora también trabaja con el fin de ayudar a su esposa y sacar adelante a su familia. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio con muy pocas cantidades de ropa, y al ver que sus clientes respondieron decide invertir un poco mas, Bernarda es una mujer que le gusta luchar, a pesar de que algunas veces tenga que viajar y recorrer muchos kilómetros. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como ropa para niños, ropa para caballeros, para damas y además sobrecamas. El sueño de Bernarda es ampliarse con este pequeño negocio, que algún día podrá convertirse en una tienda.
texts.en:
Bernarda de la Concepción A., 46 years old, is married and has 4 children. She works selling clothes. Her husband also works to help her and to support the family. She has been working in this business for 10 years. She started with very small quantities of clothes, and when she saw that her customers responded, she decided to invest a little more. Bernarda is a woman who likes to work hard, even though sometimes she has to travel, covering many kilometers. The money that she requests is for working capital to be used to buy goods such as children's, men's and women's clothing as well as bedspreads. Bernarda's dream is to develop her small business so that one day she can start a store.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel A. is borrowing PHP 23,000 from Kiva lenders as additional working capital for his farming business. He is married to Rosemalyn and they have three children. They reside in the peaceful, but distant village of Baranggay San Vicente in Angadanan, Isabela. 

Joel manages three hectares (7.5 acres) of farm lot owned by his father-in-law. He also maintains a banana plantation that serves as another source of income, while his wife manages a village store. Joel hopes to become successful in his farming business and to be able to cultivate his own farm lot.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and the majority of the people living in this region are Newars. 

Mrs. Kanchi M. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband is a driver and her son passed his SLC (School Living Certificate) exam this year and is hoping to join higher secondary school soon.

Mrs. M. opened her sandal shop a year ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different types of shoes. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy different varieties of sandals for her shop.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of sandals

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie R. owns a small rice field in her village. She is 31 years old and has four children studying. She knows very well how hard it is having a family, especially that they are just too dependent on the size of their harvest. Margie would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase a sack of urea and a bag of ammonium sulfate. She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to improve the normal yield of their farm. CEVI helps their small business grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Isabel Timotea

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Isabel es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Isabel vende ropa variada de acuerdo a pedidos, los productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y Huancayo, sus ventas son al crédito.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y casacas.
Los sueños de Isabel son tener capital propio, mas productos y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Ccatarisun, which means “Lift Us” in Quechua, Community Bank. Isabel is 27, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Isabel sells various clothes according to her orders. She gets her products in the cities of Lima and Huancayo. She sells on credit. Isabel needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy pants and jackets. Isabel’s dreams are to have her own capital, more products, and to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants and jackets

loans.name: Domnic Osoro

texts.en:
Domnic Osoro, 28, has been a mechanic for eight years. He is married to Elizabeth and they have two children ages 6 and one. His skills has enabled him to feed his family and cater to their needs.

He did not know how he could access a loan until a his friend told him about KADET Ltd. After making inquiries in he decided to register as a member and client. This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He hopes to use the money to build a shelter, since he currently he works outdoors.

He aspires to have a big garage with a spare-parts shop one day.

loans.use: Rent an enclosure

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a member of the Semtema A borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa,  she is 39 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 19, 15, 12, and 4 years old. She also cares for other 1 dependent.

Rukia has owned a stationary business for 3 years, she works 11 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rukia`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more books, pen, pencil for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rukia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stationary for sale

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katarina T. is a 70 years-year-old woman living in the town of Vaitele-K Fou.  She is widowed and has 7 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Katarina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  Katarina has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately $350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Katarina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Katarina has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment.  Katarina is now requesting a new loan of $1500 WST which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Katarina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Lucila Noemí

texts.es:
La señora LUCILA NOEMÍ R. R., tiene 39 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria. Está casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños quienes  depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos .
Este es su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para comprar cosméticos como: cremas, colonias, perfumes, labiales, joyas, talcos, etc. Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y así obtener dinero para criar y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora LUCILA NOEMÍ R. R. is 39 years old, and lives in the Trujillo district of Trujillo province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank "Esfuerzo de Mujeres II." She has completed 5 years of secondary studies, and is married with two small children who depend on her economically. She is engaged in the business of selling cosmetics. This is her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy cosmetics such as; creams, cologne, perfumes, lipstick, jewelry, bath powder, etc. She dreams of increasing her sales and in this way earning more money for the care and education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as creams, cologne, perfumes, lipstick, jewelry, and bath powder

loans.name: Miriam Danixa

texts.es:
La señora MIRIAM DANIXA B. P., tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LUIS ALBERTO SANCHEZ. Presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
MIRIAM se dedica a la venta de pollo en el mercado cercano a su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró mayólicas para arreglar su puesto del mercado y también compró pollo.
Con este crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles comprará pollo y también guardará un poco para capital para poder comprar pollo al por mayor para las fiestas de fin de año y así poder estar bien abastecida para cubrir todos sus pedidos y poder aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ganancias.
Ella sueña con tener aumentar sus ventas,ahorrar un poco de dinero y tener otro puesto de pollo en otro mercado
texts.en:
Miriam Danixa B. P. is 40 years old and lives in Las Delicias district of Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She belongs to the Luis Alberto Sanchez community bank. She has finished schooling through the 5th level of secondary school, is married, and has 4 dependent children. Miriam sells chicken in the market near her house. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought ceramic tiles to fix her market stall and also bought chicken. With this loan of 1,500 PEN she will buy chicken. She will also save capital to buy poultry at wholesale prices for the holidays at the end of the year, so that she will be well-stocked to cover all her orders and thus increase sales and earn greater income. She dreams of increasing sales so that she can save enough money to open another poultry stall in a different market.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and working capital reserve.

loans.name: Kène

texts.fr: Kène F. est une femme mariée de 37 ans. Elle fait un commerce de mil, arachide, haricot et en même temps s’active dans l’élevage ovin. Son objectif est d’augmenter son commerce afin d’avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Kène F. is a 37-year-old married woman. She does commerce in millet, peanuts, and beans. And the same time, she is actively raising sheep. Her objective is to increase her commerce to have financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in millet, peanuts, and to raise livestock

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents. Ahmad is a hard-working man and has three years' experience as a decorations specialist. Today he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy appliances for his work to earn more income to satisfy the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy appliances

loans.name: Djobo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur s’est lancé en 2008 dans le commerce  de sacs de riz, il dispose d’une grande clientèle. Beaucoup de propriétaire de restaurant viennent s’approvisionner chez lui. La demande de ces derniers jours est assez forte à cause des fêtes de fin d’année, il veut s’approvisionner pour répondre à la demande de ses clients raison pour laquelle  il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 sacs de riz et commencer le commerce de boissons avec 30 cartons de boissons et divers
texts.en:
In 2008, this gentleman got started in the commerce of rice.  He has a large customer base.  Many restaurant owners come to him to stock up.  The demand over these last few days is fairly strong due to the year-end holidays.  He wants to resupply himself to respond to the demands of his customers.  For these reasons, he's requesting from WAGES his first loan to buy 30 sacks of rice and to start selling beverages with 30 boxes of drinks and various other items. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice, boxes of canned drinks, and more

loans.name: Tarangire Group

texts.en:
Hamida T., age 47, is a widow and has four children. She has sold bites (bread-like rolls) and fabrics since 1990 and is able to able to earn a monthly profit of around 280,000 Tanzanian shillings or $210 USD.

This will be Hamida’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Hamida hopes to obtain the loan to increase her business.
	
Hamida will share this loan with her loan group, which totals seven members. In the photo, Hamida is on the left in the white shirt.

loans.use: To increase her fabric business

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah N. is a 29 year old married mother of four children between 3 and 10 years of age. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Faridah owns a four room house. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.  

Faridah has a used clothing stall in Kawala. She incurs transport costs buying second hand clothes from the Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala  She works five days a week. Faridah receives an average of 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. Besides the clothing business ,she also sells raw food.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, monthly market dues for her business and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation of bales of clothes. 

Faridah has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for four years servicing her eighth loan, working with the same group mates. Faridah joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes. In the future, Faridah hopes to see her business grow and to start exporting clothes directly.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth P. D. L. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango, departamento D. San Salvador. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, y su hija menor D. edad quien estudia. Sandra posee una librería, y así mismo comercializa otros tipos D. productos como: carteras, bolsones, cajas para regalo y cosméticos, todo con el fin D. poder contar con mayor cantidad D. clientes y obtener ganancias extras las cuales son muy necesarias para ella. Sandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar papelería al mayor, D. manera que pueda obtenerlo a menores precios, así mismo comprar más cosméticos. Todo  esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder mejorar sus ventas, aumentando su inventario, ya que D. esta forma ella podrá obtener mayor clientela vender más sus productos.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth P. D. L. is 50 years old and lives in Ilopango, in the Departament of San Salvador, El Salvador. She owns a house where she lives with her husband, who is a bricklayer, and her daughter who is in school. Sandra has a stationery and office supply store where she also sells products such as wallets, bags, gift boxes and cosmetics. She sells various items in order to attract a greater number of customers and gain the income that she needs. Sandra is asking for a loan with which she can buy paper goods in bulk, so that she can get them at lower prices. She would also like to buy more cosmetics. In general she would like to increase her inventory in order to attract more customers and improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper goods and cosmetics

loans.name: Hiram

texts.en: Hiram is a 29-year-old man who runs a studio and employs one person.  He has been in the business for four years.  Previously, he was operating a green grocery.  He earns extra income from farming horticultural crops and dairy farming. His wife is a teacher.  Hiram previously took a loan of Kes. 35,000 from Faulu Kenya and he claims that since then he has become financially stable.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to purchase carpets, cables, speakers, films and digital cameras for his studio.  He hopes to open several other shops in Limuru town.  He sees himself owning a film-processing studio in Nairobi and importing cameras in the future.

loans.use: Buy carpets, cables, speakers, films and digital cameras

loans.name: Zhullin (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhullin se encuentra formado en la ciudad de Azogues en la región centro sur del país,  esta ciudad se caracterizada por la arquitectura  de sus iglesias como  la que se encuentra en la cima de una montaña y la belleza de la ciudad se han convertido en los principales atractivos turísticos,  su gente luchadora  siempre está en busca de días mejores para sus familias al igual que nuestras socias y nos lo demuestran con el esfuerzo diario que realizan en cada uno de sus trabajos.

La señora María López tiene 44 años vive en la comunidad de Zhullin en la ciudad de Azogues, concibió cinco hijos que se encuentran entre 25 y 15 años de edad, sus primeros cuatro hijos ya son casados,  tres de ellos viven en la ciudad de Quito, su hija de 18 años tambien casada  vive en su casa y comparte con ella no sólo el techo sino también los gastos del hogar mientras que su ultima hija aún es estudiante de secundaria.

Nuestra socia tiene un pequeño restaurante donde demuestra su rica sazón, también faena  chanchos los días jueves y sábados para atraer más clientela, lleva 15 años realizando sin descanso esta actividad, su horario es extendido pues inicia a las 06h00 y concluye a las 22H00 porque en el mismo local esta una pequeña tienda propiedad de su hija.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con  la fundación y con  el préstamo solicitado va a comprar chanchos, colas, cerveza, choclos, arroz, azúcar, etc. para abastecer su negocios.

Su meta es  tener una tienda bien surtida para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Rosa C. tiene 58 años es otra de las socia del banco comunal Zhullin, vive en su casa propia con dos hijos aun solteros de los siete que concibió  pues los otros ya son casados y viven independientes y tambien con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura 

Nuestra socia se dedica  a la cría de pollos, cuyes,  siendo esta labor inculcada por sus padres, sus animales los vende cuando tiene algun apuro  económico, se enteró de la institución y sus beneficios gracias a un promotor de crédito y  éste es su segundo ciclo en su banco comunal, con el nuevo crédito que reciba va a comprar  cuyes y gallina para incrementar su criadero.

Su sueño es poder conservar su salud para seguir trabajando y así salir  adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The Zhullin communal bank is in the city of Azogues in the central part of the country. This city is renowned for the architecture of its churches, like the one that is located on top of a mountain and the city’s beauty, which have become its main tourist attractions. Its residents are tenacious folk that always seek better days for their families, just like our members do, and they prove this with the daily efforts they put into their work. María López, 44, lives in the Zhullin neighborhood of Azogues. He has 5 children who are between 25 and 15 years of age. Her first four children are already married; three of them live in Quito. Her 18-year-old daughter is also married and lives with her, sharing not only the roof over their heads but also household expenses. Her youngest daughter is still in secondary school. Our member has a small restaurant where she shows off her delicious cooking. She also butchers pigs Thursdays and Saturdays to attract more customers. She has been working thus for 15 years non-stop. Her work day is extended; she starts at 6 am and ends at 10 pm because her daughter has a small store in the same locale. This is her second loan cycle with the foundation and will use these funds to buy pigs, soft-drinks, beer, corn, rice, sugar, etc. to stock her businesses. Her goal is to have a well-stocked store to provide good customer service. Rosa C., 58, is another member of the Zhullin communal bank. She lives in her own home with her two, unmarried sons and her husband, who is a farmer. She has a total of 7 children but the others are married and live independently. Rosa raises chickens and guinea pigs. She learned these skills from her parents. When she has an unexpected financial need, she sells her animals. She found out about the institution and its benefits thanks to a credit promoter. This is her second loan cycle in her communal bank. She will use this new loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens to increase the size of her nursery. Her dream is to stay healthy and continue working to get ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs, soft-drinks, beer, corn, rice, sugar, etc. for her dishes in the restaurant and to stock her store; to buy guinea pigs and chickens to increase the size of her nursery.

loans.name: Abdou Ganiou

texts.fr: Cet homme est un père de famille, il a 02  enfants et sa femme est une coiffeuse, pour subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de sa famille, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de détail de pneus. Il a une clientèle très  grande. Il s’approvisionne au marché local du port de Lomé. le stock dont il dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses clients raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter  une vingtaine de pneus.
texts.en:
This man is the father of two children and his wife works as a hairdresser. To meet daily family responsibilities, he took up the business of selling tires at retail. He has a large client base. He gets his supplies at the local market at the port of Lomé. His current stock does not allow him to meet the demand of his clients; he is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy about about 20 tires.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en: Nickson is a 24-year-old single man. He runs a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as sugar, rice, cooking fat, and cereals. He has been in this business for four years and has one employee. His business is located in the Kibera slums in Nairobi, the capital city. He hopes to grow his business and improve his living standard in the future. He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of sugar, cooking fat, and cereals.

loans.use: To add to his stock of sugar, soda, cereals, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more articles to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan trabaja como chofer (driver) de transporte inter-departamental, su esposa elabora repostería en general.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Alto Miraflores  de la ciudad de La Paz en casa en anticrético
El crédito será destinado para capital de anticrético (Aumentar su anticrético y mejorar su calidad de vida).Vana alquilar un departamento más grande.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan works as a driver in long-distance transportation. His wife makes pastries. They are from the Alto Miraflores neighborhood of the city of La Paz, where they live a home that is leased in an anticrético arrangement. (An anticrético is an arrangement where the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum of money at the beginning of the rental term, and then receives the principal back at the end of the lease term. The landlord has the use of the money over the rental term; this is, in effect, his rent.) This loan will be used for anticrético capital (to increase their capital to improve their quality of life.) They are going to rent a larger apartment. This is the 4th time that he has requested a loan from Impro, and he has demonstrated responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to use in an anticrético arrangement to rent a bigger apartment to live more comfortably

loans.name: Puka Pukayoq Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Puka Pukayoq”, actualmente se encuentra en el VI ciclo y está conformado por 12 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El banco comunal está representado por los socios, Mercedes es la presidenta, Brigida es la secretaria, Valentina es la tesorera y Paulina es la fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en la casa D. la señora Valentina que muy amablemente les cedió un espacio D. domicilio.
       
Las actividades económicas D. los algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta D. comida y chicha, crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y venta D. hortalizas. Otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo albañil, empleado D. la municipalidad D. Pachar. 

Mercedes, tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad D. Pachar. 

Mercedes nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Puka Pukayoq”  somos 12 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi actividad económica. Su actividad económica principal D. la señora Mercedes es la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, ella tiene su galpón en la comunidad D. Yanahuara. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Mercedes requiere el préstamo para comprar 20 a 30 cuyes, el par D. cuyes compra entre 15 a 20 soles dependiendo D. la raza del animal. Mercedes compra en el mercado D. Urubamba y en el mercado del puente Grau D. la ciudad del Cusco los cuyes.
texts.en:
The Puka Pukayoq community bank has 12 hard-working and enterprising female members, and is currently in its sixth cycle. These women are always looking for opportunities to get ahead, and strive daily to proviD. a better future for their children. The bank is represented by its president, Mercedes; secretary, Brigida; treasurer, Valentina; and auditor, Paulina. The members meet every 30 days in Valentina's home, which she has very happily opened to them. Examples of members' activities incluD. the sale of food and chicha (liquor); raising small animals such as guinea pigs; and vegetable sales. Other members offer services such as bricklaying for the municipality of Pachar. Mercedes is 34, has two children and lives in the Pachar community. She tells us: "In my community bank 'Puka Pukayoq', there are 12 of us and they elected me as a representative to tell you about my activities". She mainly raises small animals such as guinea pigs. Her storehouse is in the Yanahuara community. She has been doing this for two years and it is going very well. Mercedes is requesting this loan to buy 20 to 30 guinea pigs. A pair of guinea pigs costs between 15 and 20 soles depending on the breed. She buys guinea pigs in the Urubamba and puente Grau markets in Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Mrs. Saing P. is 39 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City, where she has established a small family home with other members. Her husband provides a little income to support the family’s living expenses by driving a ferry boat. The couple is blessed with three young kids who are enrolled in the local primary school.

Saing P. built a workshop located along the street where she sells inventory to people who are passersby. She sells items like cane goods, snack food, and some sweets both retail and wholesale.

Saing P. wants to decorate her shop because she hopes it may attract more clients. Then she wishes to accumulate more inventory for her store. In order to make that possible, she decided to ask for a Kiva loan of $1,000 through HKL.

loans.use: To decorate her workshop and accumulate more inventory

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: La señora Sara M. L. desde hace  8 años se dedica a la venta de pan que ella elabora, tiene variedad  como lo son las empanadas de calabaza y panques esto lo distribuye entres sus amistades, mini súper, misceláneas y tiendas de abarrotes a un bajo precio de acuerdo a la situación económica de sus compradores. Sara es una mujer emprendedora pero para poder comprar la materia prima ella necesita tener capital y así crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
For the past eight years, Sra. Sara M. L. has been selling baked goods that she produces herself. She makes a variety of products ranging from pumpkin turnovers to cupcakes and distributes them among her friends, mini-supermarkets, and grocery stores at a low price depending on the financial situation of her buyers. Sara is an enterprising woman, but she needs capital in order to buy ingredients and eventually grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Massamba

texts.fr: Monsieur Massamba S. est un laveur dans une station d’essence de la place.  A la station, il se fait beaucoup d’amis , de connaissances.  Il s’est profité  et les place des produits du genre parfum, tee shirt et pantelons.  Ce qui lui fait entrer dans le petit commerce. Ainsi, il souhaitait un financement de 75 000 FCFA pour acheter des marchandises.
texts.en:
Mr. Massamba S. washes cars in a local petrol station. He has made many friends and acquaintances at the station and he has taken advantage of this in order to sell them products such as perfume, T-shirts and trousers. This has allowed him to build up a small business. As such, he would like a loan of 75,000FCFA in order to buy goods.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Ginelba

texts.es:
La señora Ginelba vive en zona de San Martin de la ciudad de la Paz, con sus esposo y sus dos niños que aun son pequeños, vive en casa de su madre y el esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte libre  pero sus ingresos son pocos por lo tanto ella vende Cds, para ayudar en su hogar; ya fue cliente de Impro y el primer préstamo se le concedió para capital; actualmente el negocio marcha muy bien y mejoro sus ingresos.
El préstamo que solicita será para ampliar su negocio y comprar productos de belleza YAMBAL y también más CDs para su venta al por menor.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Ginelba lives in the San Martin area in the city of La Paz with her husband and their two small children. She lives with her mother and her husband works as a self employed taxi driver, but his wages are low. For this reason she sells CDs to help with the household expenses. She is a client of Impro and the first loan she was granted provided her with capital. Currently, her business is doing very well and her income has increased. She is requesting a loan to expand her retail business and buy Yanbal beauty products and also, more CDs to sell. Due to her social character, she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase CDs and Yanbal beauty products to sell retail

loans.name: Magie

texts.en:
Magie G. is from the village of Salay Angadanan, Isabela. She is 32 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Magie owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Magie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Magie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Magie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Magie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. is from the village of Ubong, Solana, Cagayan. She is 52 years old. Norma is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Norma raises poultry. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks to produce eggs for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. Norma is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase medication for her ducks. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medication for ducks

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita, de 25 años, es una joven madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Félix de 26 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Nicole de 7 y Puyol de 4 años, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Los días de Jovita comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su esposo recorren los verdes cerros de su poblado, hasta llegar a sus cultivos y comienzan su labor diaria de trabajar la tierra, cultivando arveja y papa que son de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Jovita, 25, is a young, very unassuming, hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband, Félix, 26, and their two beloved children, Nicole, 7, and Puyol, 4, for whom she wants to provide a better future. Jovita starts her day very early in the morning when she and her husband wander over the green hills in their township until they reach their farmlands and then start their daily work of tilling the soil, cultivating peas and potatoes which are of very good quality and therefore highly sought after in Tarma’s wholesale market. What she enjoys the most about her work is caring for the crops. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to transport her product to Tarma because the sacks are very heavy and they tire her out a lot. In the future she’d like to buy new fields to increase production. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she expects to be very punctual with her repayments because she doesn’t want to cause her communal bank, in which she is very happy, any problems. She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more manure to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Alberto; El socio tiene 28 años de edad;  él es soltero  y viene trabajando elaborando mochilas, carteras, billeteras y mucho ma sen cuero, el socio se considera artesano y le encanta utilizar su ingenio para elaborar una y mil curiosidades utiles para las personas. El socio trabaja con este arte desde hace 3 años y el desea a futuro exponer su arte y tener su local en pleno corazón turístico de Cusco. El socio requiere capital de trabajo para comprar materiales como cuero, hilos, cuerdas, mostacillas entre otros. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alberto belongs to the "Caminemos Juntas" (Let's Walk Together) Communal Bank.  This bank is situated in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.    Alberto is 28 years old and single.

He works making backpacks, purses, wallets, and many other leather items.  He is an artisan, and he delights in using his talent to make a thousand and one useful items.  He has worked at this art for three years.  In the future he wishes to display his art and to have a place in the heart of the tourist center in Cusco.

Alberto needs working capital to buy leather, thread, rope, and beads, among other things.  He is requesting the loan to buy materials.  He values and is grateful for the loan that has been provided,  and he pledges to make his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 38 years old. She is married and has 7 children between the ages of 1 and 15. Six of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a driver. Francoise sells food stuffs such as maize flour and rice, and has spent 10 years in this business.

With this loan, she will buy more sacks of maize flour and rice to sell. With the profit from this business she will increase the volume of sales. She says her business succeeds because her shop is very popular. In the future, she would like to have a standard business to the extent of becoming the supplier to others.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.name: Marisela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marisela  es una joven muy trabajadora, se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de cosméticos.
Iniciando hace tres años, con poco dinero, que le dieron de su liquidación y que ha venido invirtiendo con el apoyo de Afodenic por medio del financiamiento lo que ha logrado aprovechar para su crecimiento en inventario y que le ha ayudado para suplir sus necesidades personales.
Con este nuevo financiamiento comprara ropa variada para dama, niños y caballeros, zapatos y parte en productos de cosméticos ya que es lo que más vende a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder comprar vitrinas para tener mejor vista, logrando el aumento de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marisela is a young, hard-working woman who sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics.
She began three years ago with little money which she received from her sales and she has been using it for the business with the support of Afodenic. With the loans that she  has received, she has been able to grow her inventory and these loans have also helped her with personal needs.
With this new loan she will buy assorted clothing for women, men and children, shoes, and Marisela will use some for cosmetics which is what she sells the most to her customers.  Her plans are to buy showcases to better display the products, so that her sales will improve.

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing for men, women and chldren, shoes and cosmetic products

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 51  años, vive en casa propia, está casado con la señora Amada Duarte, tienen seis hijos de los cuales 3 ya son profesionales y los restantes  están cursando sus respectivos estudios, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres todos tienen posibilidad de recibir buena educación.
Pedro emprendió su actividad como carpintero hace más de 25 años, heredó la profesión de su padre quién fue unos de los carpinteros más conocido de la ciudad, Pedro cuenta con clientela formada. Realiza todo tipo de muebles para cocinas, puertas talladas, marcos para puertas y ventanas.
Pedro es un señor muy sacrificado quien se esfuerza diariamente para brindarle lo mejor a su familia y buena educación a sus hijos para adquirir una profesión universitaria.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de maderas en general para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Pedro is 51 and lives in his own home with his wife Amada Duarte. They have six children, 3 of whom are already professionals and the rest are studying. Thanks to their parents' efforts they all have a chance to receive a good education. 

Pedro started as a carpenter more than 25 years ago. He learned from his father who was on of the most recognized carpenters in the city. Pedro has an established clientele. He makes all types of kitchen cabinets, doors, door frames and windows.

Pedro is a dedicated man who strives daily to offer his family a better quality of life and a good education for his children, so they can get a college degree. He needs the loan to buy different wood to increase his stock.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Kareema's Group

texts.en:
Kareema is a housewife who stays at home and does her household chores. She is a very responsible person who does her work with a good sense of responsibility and effort. Her husband, A. G., is a driver by profession; he drives a rickshaw. Kareema has 2 sons. Her elder son is also a rickshaw driver and her younger son works in a factory for a low wage and sells bangles on a part-time basis to different jewelry shops to supplement his income.

Kareema has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to improve her younger son’s bangles sales business. By investing loan money into his business, he will be able to sell a larger quantity of bangles to his clients and make more money for the family. Kareema is confident that by using his 10 years of experience in this business, he will successfully be able to improve its condition. Kareema is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, Kareema is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy bangles to sell

loans.name: Bronson

texts.en:
Bronson is a single man who lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is transport.

He has operated a cobbling shoes business for the last three years, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby.  Bronson faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He hopes to open a big retail shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase beads and leather to make shoes for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of its affordable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase beads and leather to make shoes for sale.

loans.name: Laura Emilia

texts.es:
Laura Emilia C. S. tiene 28 años de edad,  Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Laura Emilia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa  y un terreno.

Le gusta escuchar música y atender a sus hijos.
texts.en: Laura Emilia C. S. is 28, and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 4 children. The V.R.C. San Jacinto is located in the Campo Alegre district, in the Guare Parish belonging to the Baba Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour-the sowing of corn and rice. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Laura Emilia works in agriculture sowing corn and rice. She purchases her products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa Markets and sells them in the Lopez Market. She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as pests, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a house and a plot of land. She enjoys listening to music and taking care of her children.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is a 51-year-old married woman with eight children, who lives in her own house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the produce business for 30 years. Her hardships include bad climatic changes and limited capital. Her vision is to have a big store for the produce. Sylvia needs the credit to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida B. is from the village of Deboloc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. Nida owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad. Reside junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en su casa propia en la parte rural del caserío Barrio Libre. Se ubica en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace cuatro años, María ha dirigido una pequeña bodega instalada en su propio domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de su madre así que conoce el rubro a la perfección. Ofrece a una clientela ya establecida en la zona artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Con su negocio, ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María desea ampliar su bodega comprando más mercadería con la finalidad de incrementar sus productos y obtener más ventas diarias. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles. 

María es una mujer bastante trabajadora y encargada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
María is the 36 year old mother of a family.  She lives together with her husband and their four children in her own home, in the rural part of the small town Barrio Libre.  It is located in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area that is located in the province Piura, a little more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.
