Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Mr. Saroem R. is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokhem Kong, is 29 years old.  They have been married since 2004 and have one daughter. The family lives along National Road No. 5, approximately 20 kilometers from the capital city of Cambodia, Phnom Penh. Saroem was not in the photo; instead, his wife is shown.

Saroem has been operating a motorbike-washing business in his village since 2007. His wife assists her husband in the business. He is a fisherman as well.

Saroem is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to build a shelter where he will operate his motorbike washing and cleaning business.

loans.use: To build a place where he can operate his washing and cleaning motorbike business.

loans.name: Nkai

texts.en:
Nkai M. is a 32-year-old gentleman who is married to Silantoi M.. Together they have four school-going children. Nkai has been farming for the last six years. He then sells the produce at a profit.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan; he is planning to spend it to prepare land for planting more potatoes and also to buy some chemicals to spray those he has already planted. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Nkai’s dream is to do large-scale farming and be the best potato farmer in his area. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his goals

loans.use: To prepare land for planting potatoes and buy chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil and more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel L. O. de 31 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual posee una tortillería la cual se encuentra en su casa de habitación, en donde vive junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar educación básica y junto a su madre de 70 años de edad. Reina se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, las cuales comercializa de lunes a domingo tanto al mediodía como por las tardes, su madre le ayuda a hacer el trabaja más eficiente, ya que ella cuenta con varios clientes, los cuales se saturan, sobre todo en las horas pico. Este ha sido un negocio de mucha ayuda tanto para Reina como para toda su familia, por lo que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, de esta misma forma comprar tambos de gas propano para poder contar con un pequeño almacenamiento de este, ya que en ocasiones durante el año el gas escasea lo que es muy perjudicial para su negocio. Reina es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza al máximo por su familia.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel L. O. is 31 years old and lives in the municipality of San Martín, located in the department of San Salvador. This is where she has a tortilla shop which is located in her house. She lives with her two children, who are ages 10 and 4 and who study at the elementary school, and her mother who is 70 years old. Reina works making and selling tortillas, which she sells Monday through Sunday, more around midday than in the afternoons. Her mother helps her so she is able to work more efficiently in order for her to be able to help the many customers who fill her business, especially during peak hours. This business has been a great help for Reina and her whole family. She is requesting this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of corn and, also, to buy cans of propane gas to be able to keep some in storage for occasions during the year when gas is running short which can be detrimental for her business. Reina is a very hardworking woman especially when it is for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Vichet

texts.en:
Mr. Vichet N., is 31 years old and his wife, Mrs. Phary Phat (pictured), is 28 years old. They live in a village along National Road Number Two approximately 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2009 and have two sons. One of them attends school and another one is still too young for school. His wife stays at home and takes care of their sons.

Vichet is an ice deliveryman. He buys ice and then delivers it to customers who have businesses that require ice, such as people who sell cold drinks or noodles. Vichet lends coolers to his new customers to keep the ice cold. He needs to buy more coolers for his customers, but he does not have money.  Therefore, he is applying for his first loan of $700 in order to make the purchases.  

Vichet is not in the photo. Instead, his wife was available for the photo.

loans.use: To use for his ice delivery business

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha de 31 años,  vive en el Fortín una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la casa de sus padres. 

Ella comenzó con su tienda en el 2005 desde que le dieron una parte de una herencia y toda la invirtió en readecuar su casa para ubicar una pequeña tienda, se levanta todos los días desde las 05h30am cuando sus tres hijos se vana a la escuela y después abre la tienda. Vende todo tipo de víveres como arroz, azúcar, aceites etc.   

Para surtir mas su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, pañales y un congelador para las carnes. En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio para poder asegurar la economía de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha, age 31, lives in El Fortin, an area known for its dirt roads and informal vendors. She runs a small general store from her parents' home.

She started her business in 2005, when she was given an inheritance, which she then invested in remodeling the house to set up her small shop. She wakes up every day at 5:30 in the morning, when her three children go to school. She then opens her shop in which she sells all types of provisions like rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

In order to better stock her shop, she would like to purchase rice, diapers, and a meat freezer with this loan. In the future, she would like to open up another business in order to ensure a steady income for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, diapers, and a freezer

loans.name: Oscar Andrés

texts.es: Oscar tiene la edad de 20 años, es casado, y vive con su esposa. El tiene el deseo de empezar su propio negocio y con ese fin usará el préstamo en la compra de materia prima para iniciar la fabricación de block (un tipo de ladrillo grande hecho de cemento). Cuenta con la maquina para laborar esta producto y experiencia en la fabricación. Está el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera de tener más ingresos para invertir más y poder cumplir las metas economicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar, 20, is married and lives with his wife.  He wants to start his own business and will use the loan to buy raw materials to start manufacturing blocks (a type of large brick made from cement).  He has both the machine needed to make this product and experience making it.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms granted.  He hopes to have more income to invest more and reach his family’s economic goals.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make concrete blocks.

loans.name: Without Money Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Without Money” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of previous loans, they were able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Memuna C.. Memuna is age 55. She was born in Freetown but currently resides in Makeni together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a farmer. One of her children is attending primary school and three are in secondary school. For 10 years now, Memuna has been selling dishes, rubber bowls, palm oil, etc. With this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large number to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy dishes, rubber bowls, palm oil, etc.

loans.name: Andres Avelino Caceres Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ANDRES AVELINO CACERES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha; ella tiene 35 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la atención y venta D. caldos, ella atienD. desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, prepara diferentes caldos D. pollo y carne, su esposo trabaja como cocinero y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un negocio propio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carnes y verduras.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. animales, restaurant, artesanía, venta D. frutas y  venta D. chicha.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the communal bank "ANDRES AVELINO CACERES". This bank is situated in the Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.

One member of the group is Martha, who is 35 years old and lives with her partner and has 2 children. Martha prepares and sells soup, serving it from 9:00am until 6:00pm. She serves different soups maD. from chicken or meat. Her live-in partner works as a cook and together they raise their children. Martha wishes to have her own business. She is applying for the loan in order to buy products to cook, such as meat and vegetables.

The other members of the group sell animals, handicrafts, fruit, chicha (fermented beverage maD. from maize), and have a restaurant.

Martha is grateful to those who play a part in achieving this dream by these means and commits to making payments in the established repayment term.

loans.use: The group member is applying for a loan to buy products to cook such as meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Lassie

texts.en: This is 47 year-old Lassie. She is married and has five children ages 4, 7, 9, 12 and 16. In 2005, Lassie established her textile and suitcase business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband improve their home from the profit generated from her sales. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to add more stock to the business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 800,000. In the future, Lassie plans to educate her children and buy land to build a house. She wants to purchase stock from Sierra Leone's neighboring country, Guinea, to make more profit by selling wholesale to other traders. She is very hard working and dedicated and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy suitcases and clothing

loans.name: Nourng

texts.en:
Nourn Y., 28, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  He is a construction worker earning about $2 per day.  His wife makes about $1.50 a day by working in a factory.

Y. spends $50 on food, $3 on electricity and water supplies and $40 on other necessary expenses every month.

He is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for family use.  In the future, he would like to use any additional profits to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is clothing.

She has operated a food selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Umazi faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to build her own house and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flours and rice. She decided to join Yehu because of simple joining procedures.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flours and rice.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes forma parte del banco comunal “Los Pioneros” perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares. Ella tiene un almacén en su casa, en donde vende principalmente abarrotes, desde hace 3 años. Este negocio, aunque no le produce muchas ganancias, debido a que tiene cerca supermercados y ferias libre, le ha servido para vivir, cubriendo sus necesidades básicas (alimentación y pago de cuentas). Vive sola con su esposo. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería. 
A pesar que Mercedes, producto del pasado terremoto del 27 de febrero de este año, perdió el 90% de su mercadería, tuvo un pequeño derrumbe de una pared de su casa y padece un dolor constante en una de sus piernas debido a várices,  ha podido mantenerse animada para continuar con su negocio e incluso soñar con tener una pequeña amasandería. 
A Mercedes le han servido mucho los préstamos para seguir adelante con su negocio. Además le gusta mucho la relación que existe entre sus compañeros de grupo, el buen trato de su asesora y las enseñanzas sobre cómo atender correctamente a los clientes. 
 Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Mercedes is part of the communal bank "The Pioneers" belonging to the city of Linares. She has had a grocery shop in her house for 3 years, selling mainly groceries. This business, although it has not produced many profits because of nearby supermarkets and street markets, has enabled her to live, covering her basic necessities (food and bills). She lives with her husband. With this loan, she will purchase merchandise, since, due to the recent earthquake of February 27 of this year, Mercedes lost 90% of her merchandise because of a small collapse of one wall in her house. She suffers constant pain in one of her legs because of varicose veins, but she has been able to keep herself going by keeping up with her business, including her dream to have a small bakery. Loans have very much helped Mercedes to get ahead in her business. She also very much enjoys the relationships among her fellow group members, the good treatment from her consultant, and classes about how to correctly help clients.
Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region, located in the central region of the country. In this zone, agricultural production and wine production have been developed in an important way, excelling in the export sphere. They emphasize cultivation of cereals (rice, wheat, corn and oats), produce (sugar beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard, and other vegetables) and fruits. Linares is the principal provincial rice producer in Chile; in fact, 78% of the national production of this grain is done in this province, especially in the municipality of Parral.

loans.use: Mercadería

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian D. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Vivian is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vivian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and detergents. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Vivian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & detergents

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann D. is from the village of Cabaruguis St. Dist. 4, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Mary Ann is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann runs a general store, where she sells a variety of products in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for more than 8 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month.

Mary Ann joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting her first loan, for 10000 PHP, to be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatros hijos en su casa propia en la parte rural del caserío Palominos. Esta comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres años, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Cuenta con una vitrina y unos accesorios en su casa que usa para exhibir sus productos. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona como vende sus productos entre sus vecinos y amistades. En esta temporada, tiene más pedidos por atender debido a la campaña de Mangos que trae más gente a su caserío. 

Para satisfacer la aumentación de la demanda de su clientela, Ana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería con nuevos diseños. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ana, 32, is a mother living with her husband and four children in her own house in the rural section of Palominos.  This community is located in Tambogrande district, an agricultural zone located in Piura province over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She has been selling clothes for three years.  She has a display case and some accessories at home she uses to exhibit her wares.  She has an established customer base in the area since she sells her items among her neighbors and friends.  During this season demand is higher because it’s mango season and this brings more people into her hamlet.

To meet increased customer demand, Ana wants to expand the business buying more merchandise with new designs.  She has, therefore, thought it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan.

loans.use: To acquire more clothing.

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia D. is from the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 39 years old and the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virginia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling detergent and bar soaps. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Virginia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta O. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Benedicta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Benedicta owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating "tricycle" (three-wheeled) transport services. Benedicta is just starting this business.

In 2011, Benedicta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benedicta is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the first loan taken out by Benedicta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Sary

texts.ar: ساري في عمر 29 سنة اعزب ويعمل في محل كوافير رجالي له في عمله 6 سنوات يحب عمله وقد طوره كثيرا منذ البدء به وهو يرغب كثيرا في تأسيس عائلة ودعم عائلته يتميز بالدقة في العمل والتجدد يريد ان يطور عمله بشكل مستمر لقد ساهم القرض السابق بدعم محله وتطويره يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة للمحل ومساعدة الأخ في تطوير عمله من خلال تطوير معمل الأخ للألمينيوم فهو يحب عائلته ويريد لأخيه ان يعتمد على نفسه وان يطور عمله حتى يصبح معتمدا على نفسه وهذه من خلال القيم والروابط الأسرية التي يتمتع بها ساري
texts.en: Sary is 29 years old and unmarried. He works in a barber shop for men and has been doing this for six years. He loves his business and has developed it considerably since its inception. He deeply wishes to settle down with his own family. He is distinguished with attention to detail and keeping up to date, and wants to develop his business in a sustainable manner. The last loan helped him develop his business and with this loan he would like to buy some new equipment. He would also like to help his brother develop his own business as he wants him to be independent; this is due to Sary's values and the family ties he enjoys.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his barber shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old. She is a member of the Furaha group in Faulu Kenya and is a businesswoman. Since 2006, Mary has run a tailoring business. She is able to run her business well because she received training from Faulu Kenya about how to keep business records. 

Mary has applied for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a sewing machine and fabric. In the future, she would like to export horticultural products.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Saiful

texts.en: Saipul A. works as a fisherman on the island of Menjangan in the western part of Bali. Saipul A. is a diver. At this time he is using his own boat, but still relies on the wind to go to sea and the results are not optimal. He borrowed Rp. 10,000,000 at MUK to buy a boat engine so he could explore the wider marine and get maximum results. He already has a customer that will buy the fish. Saiful A. lives off the coast. He spends Rp. 30 000 per day for meals and Rp. 120,000 for electricity.

loans.use: To buy a boat engine

loans.name: Kwame Mkuruma Group

texts.en:
Damian K., who is in his early thirties, is married with three children who are still going to school.  He is an electrician. He works from 8.00am to 8.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Damian's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He hopes for a loan to repair and renovate his office.  His dream is to one day start selling cosmetics.

Damian will share this loan with his loan group "Kwame Mkuruma", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture, Damian is 1st on the left in front, in a blue shirt.

loans.use: to repair and renovate his office.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es: La Sra. Estefanía vive en la zona de chacacollo,   tiene 3 hijos, esta divorciada, cuenta que un momento difícil para ella lo de la separación pero ahora se recupero y salió adelante por el bienestar de sus hijitos,  sola mantiene el hogar, ella se dedica a la elaboración de comida y  atiende su local de venta de comida de lunes a domingo también realiza la venta de comida 3 veces a la semana su especialidad es el pescado, el préstamo lo invertirá para la refacción de su local, es muy conocida por la zona por su deliciosos platos, el deseo de ella es poder tener mas clientes y mas venta para así agrandar su local, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Estefanía lives in Chacacollo district.  She has three children and is divorced.  She tells us that the separation was a very difficult time for her but she got over it and kept going for the good of her young children.  Estefanía supports her household on her own.  Her business is making meals and she serves in her business premises from Monday to Sunday.  She also sells food three times a week.  Her speciality is fish.

Estefanía will invest her loan in refurbishing her sales location.  She is very well known in her district thanks to the delicious meals that she prepares.  Her wish is to have more customers and to make more sales so that she can enlarge her premises.  Estefanía is a very hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to make some repairs to her premises

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustin de 70 años es un hombre casado, padre de 5 hijos  y propietario de una ferretería en el barrio Los Andes de Barranquilla, negocio que emprendió una vez fue pensionado como empleado de una empresa y decidió dedicarse a generar segundos ingresos y principalmente para sentirse continuamente productivo. Agustín vende de contado a su principal mercado que son sus vecinos del barrio que compartes y a las comunidades de los alrededores todo lo que se requiere para desarrollar procesos constructivos y de adecuación y mejoramiento de viviendas; él poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas y tiene como meta fortalecer su negocio hasta lograr su posicionamiento y sostenibilidad como microempresa familiar. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer credikiva que el primero al que aplica en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales como clavos, tornillos, limas, pintura, yeso, cemento , destornilladores, tuberías PVC, seguetas, papel esmeril y especialmente impermeabilizadores . Su inversión planea ser exitosa porque la aplica a materiales que rotan permanentemente y su clientela conoce su potencial de oferta.
texts.en: Agustin is a 70 year old married man and a father of 5 children. He is the owner of a hardware store in the neighborhood of Los Andes de Barranquilla. He opened this business when he retired as an employee from a business and decided to have a second income and especially continue to feel productive.   Agustín sells up fron to his main customers who are residents of his neighborhood and of the nearby communities. He sells them everything they need for construction projects and to improve and adapt their homes. Little by little he has increased his sales and his goal is to have a good position and sustainability as a family micro business. At present, he is asking for his first Kiva loan at the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy materials such as nails, screws, rasps, paint, plaster, cement, screwdrivers, PVC tubing, blades, sandpaper and especially waterproofers. He plans on his investment being successful because he is using it for materials that have a permanent turnover, and his customers know the quality he offers.

loans.use: to buy materials such as nails, screws, rasps, paint, plaster, cement, screwdrivers, PVC tubing, sandpaper, and especially waterproofers.

loans.name: Akylbek

texts.en:
Akylbek is 33, married, and has four children between the ages of 5 and 15. He is a final-year student at the State University, and is also a businessman engaged in cattle-breeding.  He started his business with the initial capital of 10,000 KGS and managed to develop it to a point where the monthly profit is 5,000 – 10,000 KGS. In order to broaden his business by fattening and reselling colts, he has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS.  With the revenue, Akylbek plans to reconstruct the barn for his cattle and save money for the higher education of his elder son. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. It uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, which lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Elsa Idalia

texts.es:
Elsa es un joven muy respetuoso y le gusta trabajar mucho.
Ella está a punto de iniciar la universidad y desea comprar una computadora y una impresora las cuales son muy necesarios para los cursos que tiene que llevar, es por eso que ella necesita un préstamo de₡400 000 (cuatrocientos mil colones). 
Elsa está muy contenta porque va a estudiar y podrá tener mejores oportunidades para superarse y asegura que esta empresita le ha ayudado de forma positiva para salir adelante en proyectos personales.
Ella socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal de Superafe S.A, una de las 110 empresas de crédito socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Elsa is a very respectful young woman who likes to work hard.  She is about to start university and would like to buy a computer and a printer which she really needs for the courses that she will be taking.  For this reason, she needs a loan for 400,000 colones.

Elsa is very happy because she is going to study and will be able to enjoy better opportunities to improve herself.  She says that this company has helped her in a positive way to get ahead in her personal projects.

Elsa is a member of the Superafe Community Loan Company, one of EDESA's 110 member loan companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is 46 years old, married and has five children. She couldn't provide education facilities for all of her children due to the limited financial resources available. Only her youngest son, who is 9 years old, is studying in class 4th.

Her husband has a fruit-selling business. He puts fruit on his cart every morning and visits different streets in the city to sell by announcing in a loud voice. Sughran’s three elder sons also operate fruit-selling businesses like their father.  Sughran is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to put more fruit in his cart to sell. This will add variety to his fruit and help him sell more to increase profits. Sughran is confident that through the loan, her husband’s income will increase and she will be able to provide better living facilities to her family as a result. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a 43-year-old single woman who lives with her sister. They both take care of life's expenses. Ibtesam owns a grocery store selling food products, and this is the only source of income she has. She wants to buy more food products for her store but she doesn't have enough cash to pay for it. Therefore she wants to take a loan of $1,400.
When Ibtesam receives the loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, she will be able to purchase more goods such as more varieties of coffee, frozen food and beverages to add to her store's variety. FATEN loans are repaid on a monthly basis – this satisfies Ibtesam's needs and will increase her income so that she and her sister can have better living conditions. Ibtesam is photographed in her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase goods and expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Fanny Mercedes

texts.es:
Fanny de 32 años, esta casada, tiene un hijo de 10 años edad , ella estudio administración de empresas, pero es comerciantes, es dueña de una pulpería localizada en su casa de habitación, es originaria de León .  Ella inicio con su pulpería hace dos años este ha sido su primer negocio su esposo la apoyo con un pequeño capital que el aporto, la falta de empleo la motivo a poner su negocio empezó a vender productos comestibles después se amplio a vender ropa y cosméticos. Su hermana y su mama la ayudan a atender el negocio y su esposo aporta al hogar con lo que gana en el hospital donde el trabaja.
Requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería, como ropa, cosmético, granos básicos para su pulpería. Ella espera poder hacer crecer sus ventas, que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de su local, poder comprar más inventario que pueda vender. 
Su meta próxima es comprar 2 vitrinas de vidrio y 2 estantes metálicos donde puede poner su producto.
texts.en:
Fanny, age 32, is married and has a 10 year old son.  She studied business administration, but she is a merchant.  She owns a general store, which is located in her house.  She is from León.

She started her store two years ago.  This has been her first business, and her husband supports her with a small amount of money that he contributes.  The lack of work motivated her to set up her business.  She started selling food products, and she later expanded to sell clothes and cosmetics.  Her sister and her mother help her see to the business.  Her husband contributes to the household with what he earns from the hospital where he works.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise like clothes, cosmetics, and basic grains for her general store.  She hopes to be able to make her sales grow, which will allow her to improve the conditions of her locale.  She will be able to buy more inventory that she will be able to sell.

Her next goal is to buy two glass display cases and two metal shelves where she can place her products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes, cosmetics, and basic grains for her general store.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Seven years ago Samir decided to start his own business selling carpets. He began his own business with his hard earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. Samir has many clients and his business keeps growing. In order to increase the range of his carpets, Samir is requesting a loan for 600 AZN, which he will use to purchase more inventories. Samir is sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: purchase dowry goods to increase profit

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca vive en la urbanización 23 de marzo junto a su esposo Indalecio que es chofer asalariado que viaja a Iquique-Arica Chile, por tal motivo el esposo de la Sra. Francisca se ausenta por semanas y a veces meses de su casa, ella vive  con sus cuatro hijos uno que va a la universidad, una de ellas tiene su propio negocio en la zona de Achumani  y dos en edad escolar, la Sra. francisca vende las enaguas a las cholitas mujeres de pollera y lleva también a la provincia Villarroel donde tiene muy buena venta y de donde aparte trae los quesos por mayor para poder vender,  ella viaja cada fin de semana ya que el día de feria es el sábado y todo el día esta en su puesto de venta y tiene también familiares en la comunidad y aprovecha para visitarles,  ella solicita el  crédito para el incremento de capital de trabajo y compra de mercadería ya  tiene varios pedidos de enaguas y mantas y ella desea cubrir este pedido, es una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en: Francisca lives in the “23 de marzo” development with her husband Indalecio who is a driver.  He travels to Iquique-Arica, Chile and for this reason, he is away from home for weeks, sometimes months at a time.  Her four children also live with her; one attends university, another has his own business in the Achumani area, and two are school age.  Francisca sells underskirts to “Cholitas” (indigenous women of Bolivia) to wear under their “polleras” (traditional multi-layered skirts). She takes her merchandise to Villlarroel province where she has very good sales.  She also buys wholesale cheese there for resale.  Market day is Saturday, so she travels every weekend and works at her sales stand all day.  She has family in the community and takes advantage of the opportunity to visit them.  She is requesting the loan to increase her working capital and buy merchandise since she has various orders for underskirts and shawls and wants to fill these orders.  She is a hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy underskirts and shawls.

loans.name: Natewo Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  Pamela is the facilitator of the Natewo SHG group. Pamela and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pamela takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Pamela will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.


In 2012, the members of Natewo SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.  On the far left of the this photo, the Natewo field officer holds a One Acre fund sign.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 48 years old and married, with four children.  Julie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Julie has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.  Julie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Rebecca Nduku

texts.en:
Rebecca is 65 years old, married to Benjamin, and they have four children who are all working class. She has been in dairy farming for the last 14 years, making a monthly profit of KES.30,000.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy Unga (Kenyan brand name) feeds, hay, and milking cans.

She will use the anticipated profits to meet her basic needs and save. She hopes to have a better future in her old age and be self-sufficient financially.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with four children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a food business selling Cavendish bananas and sweet bananas. She sells her products in a rented shop. Her customers are her neighbors. She has been in business for the last 16 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of Cavendish and sweet bananas. 

Rose's goals are to see her business grow big so that she sells wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university level. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She lives in her own house and  the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas and sweet bananas.

loans.name: Aladino

texts.en:
Aladino is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married.
 
Aladino has a rice field that grows rice that he sells as rice grains per kilogram or sack during harvest time. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Aladino has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Aladino hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Bandu

texts.en:
Bandu is 44 year old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has six children between 12 and 28 years old.  All of them live at home and five are presently in  high school, while the oldest one is currently in college. 

For the past twenty years she has been selling fufu (a dumpling made from cassava) in the local market. Bandu says her business helps to sustain her children. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of fufu (African food made from cassava) for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of fufu (African food made from cassava) for her business.

loans.name: Wakulima Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wakulima Group in Western Kenya! Mary is the facilitator of the Wakulima group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mary takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Mary will educate her children and repay her loan.

In 2012, the members of Wakulima group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Mary and her group with the field officer who is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes owns her own clothing and cell shop business.  She has been in business for four years. Agnes is happily married and has one child. 

Her family lives within the village of Victory Norte, Santiago. According to her, the generated income from her business goes to the rental of house, retail shop, payment for motorcycle,allowance,daily needs and school fees of her child.  Nowadays,she is planning to buy more stock clothing since it's December and she knows that it would be sold out immediately due to the season.  For this reason, Agnes is asking for a loan P50,000 to buy clothing and cellphone accessories for her retail store business. She hopes that she can fulfill her dreams in life through her patience in managing her business. This would make her business grow and improve her financial stability, which will enable her to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cellphone accessories for retail store business

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación se han unido con el objetivo de mejorar sus estilos de vidas. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras quienes luchan por sus familias y por el bien de sus hijos.
Una de las miembros es la señora María de 35 años, esta casada con Leonardo quien trabaja en una muebleria, tienen 2 hijos. La sra Maria es una mujer que quiere empezar a vender ropas, ella comenta que este ha sido su sueño desde hace mucho tiempo, ya que desea poder ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa, Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá tener un buen stock para emprender su negocio. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Seventeen women from the city of Encarnación have joined together in order to improve their living conditions. They are hardworking and very enterprising women who fight for their families and their children’s well-being.

One of the group members is María who is 35 years old and is married to Leonardo, who works at a furniture store and with whom she has two children. María wants to start selling clothes and mentions that this has been a dream of hers for quite some time, as she wants to help her husband with the household expenses. She considers herself to be a very hardworking and enterprising woman.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of all types of clothing to build a good stock to start her business. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bundu's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school located in Boijibu village, near Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. The school serves 411 pupils and employs ten teachers. In operation since 1974, the school receives support from the government to help cover its operating costs.
However, for many of the teachers here, life can be a struggle. Many teachers therefore engage in side-projects and small businesses in order to supplement (or in some cases replace) their salaries. This group of teachers has applied for a loan of 11,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders.
Bundu is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 53 years old and has been in the teaching profession for 13 years now. He is married and has six children – two are in primary school, one is in secondary school and one is in college; the others are no longer attending schools. Bundu has requested this loan in order to purchase a piece of land for the future construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for the future construction of a house for his family

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old, married and blessed with four children. She owns a retail shop in her local trading centre and has been in operation for a period of eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is requesting her third loan with KADET LTD of KES 100,000. She will use the funds to purchase more stock, i.e. cooking fat, rice, maize flour and detergents for her business. She will plow back the anticipated profits into the business and repay the loan.

Her dream is to prosper in her business and live a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase cooking fat, sugar, maize flour and rice

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a proud and traditional farming woman. Speaking with her, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful mum, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kapsowar along with her two children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. She has been doing agriculture for 10 years now, so she makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. 

Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity. Susan is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in permanently changing the life of Susan and her family. Kindly help him out!
You can help Susan fulfill her dream and improve her business with a loan that could change her life during the Christmas holidays.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angelita currently sells clothes and perfume in her local community. She must travel door-to-door marketing her products and trying to make sales to her friends and family. It is very tough for her to sell in this manner because of the extremely hot weather. She is also very limited in the amount of clothes she can walk around with to display. Therefore, she is requesting this loan in order to make a part of her home into a clothing store. She has already designated the area but needs the capital in order to make some adjustments to the space and fix up the store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Make a part of her home into a clothing store

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina, grandmother of six, uses the TEACH Lending program of Kraban Support Foundation. She manages her business using basic bookkeeping techniques. She requires a loan of $650 to help her stay in business and expand.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Evalyne M.

texts.en: Evalyne is a mother of ten. She has been in business since 2004, operating a posho mill at the local community trading centre. Apart from the posho mill business, she also sells maize. She gets her stock of maize direct from the local farmers during harvesting season when the crop is plenty. She stores the maize and sells it later at an increased price. Through her business, she has been able to educate her children, bring services to the community since hers is the only posho mill at the centre, and also improve her living standard. With a loan from PEMCI, she intends to increase her cereal stock in order to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Nelson Miguel

texts.es:
Nelson F. is married and the father of two with a third child on the way. Five years ago his factory job was downsized. Using his severance money, he opened a small grocery store in the center of their town where he and his wife sell produce and staples such as sugar, flour and cooking oil. The shop has been very successful and they now hope to expand it. They have rented more space and are asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase inventory.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Nelson F. es casado, y es padre de dos niños y uno por nacer. El trabajan conjuntamente con su esposa atendiendo el negocio, ellos son dueños de un almacén ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Hace 5 años Nelson quedó sin trabajo por una reducción de personal que sufrió la fábrica donde él trabajaba; con la indemnización cobrada decidió abrir su propia microempresa; montó un almacén donde venda todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como hortalizas, frutas, azúcar, aceite, harina, etc. Gracias a las excelentes ganancias obtenidas ellos han decidido ampliar el negocio, alquilaron otro salón y ahora necesitan aumentar su stock de mercaderías para ello solicitan un préstamo de US$ 1000 que lo invertirán en la

loans.use: To purchase stock for a grocery store including sugar, produce, pasta, oil, flour and dairy products.

loans.name: Magda Adelia

texts.es:
Magda is married. Her husband works at an auto supply store and they have three children who are 12 years, 6 years and 10 months old. Her 12-year old daughter helps her with the business. She began the business more than a year ago when her husband was under-employed, driving a cab but not bringing in much money. She needed to clear the family's expenses so a relative gave her a small loan to set up a business selling sweets and cold drinks in the living room of her house, just to neighbors at first, but then expanding little by little.

Magda is asking for a US$325 loan to buy merchandise for her business and to continue growing it. She's offering to repay the loan in 3 months. She and her family thank you for supporting her growing business and for improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Magda es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado en una tienda de venta de accesorios para automóvil, ellos tienen tres pequeños hijos de 12 años, 6 años y 10 meses de edad, siendo su hija de 12 años la que le ayuda en su negocio. Ella empezó con su negocio hace más de un año, cuando su esposo no tenia empleo fijo, ya que en ocasiones él manejaba un taxi y no obtenía muchos ingresos y necesitaba solventar los gastos de su familia, fue por ello que un familiar le presto un pequeño capital para que ella pusiera su negocio y empezó vendiendo dulces y sodas en la sala de su casa para solo sus vecinos, luego fue creciendo y amplió su negocio poco a poco.

Magda esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 325 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y continuar creciendo con el mismo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo para continuar creciendo y poder salir adelante con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Abduhakim

texts.ru:
Abduhrakim A. is 22. He is single and has a partial college education. Despite his age he has extensive experience in sales because it is the main source of his family's income. He is in business of selling headdresses for children, belts and ties. Previously he would sell from different locations within the market. His assets amounted to $700. Thanks to MicroInvset he was able to secure a permanent point of sales, increase turnover, pay for all of his family expenses and his college education. In the future he is planing to make a trip to purchase more goods and start selling wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдурахмонов Абдухаким – 22 года. Холост, образование высшее неоконченное. Не смотря на свой возраст, имеет большой опыт в сфере торговли, так как эта деятельность является основным источником дохода семьи. Занимается торговлей головного убора для детей, ремней и галстуками. Раньше торговал в разных местах рынка с товарооборотом на 700 $. Кредитование в МЗФ Микроинвест позволило ему приобрести постоянную точку торговли, увеличить товарооборот, покрывать все расходы семьи и оплачивать учебу в университете. В будущем планирует ездить за товаром сам и перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: to start selling goods wholesale

loans.name: Liliya

texts.en:
Liliya is divorced with two children – a 20-year-old son and a 13-year-old daughter. Her family lives in Stryi. Liliya started her business 2 years ago with the help of her family who provided her with start-up capital. Today she sells women’s clothing in the central market. Her vending kiosk is very popular in the market because Liliya always offers interesting styles of clothing at reasonable prices. Currently, she has about $2000 in inventory. Her gross income per month is about $1800.

Liliya is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase winter sweaters and jackets wholesale. She is an experienced trade entrepreneur and has a good credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. We believe Liliya will work hard to earn enough money to grow her business and provide decent living standards for her kids which is her ultimate goal as a mother.

loans.use: To purchase winter sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary is married with two children. She is a tailor and mainly sews school uniforms. With the profits from her, Mary will start a tailoring school.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two teenage kids. She and her family live in Ivano-Frankivsk. Nataliya sells children’s clothing and footwear in two different locations – the central mall called “Prikarpattya” and a local market, “Troyan”, in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. She originally started as a small market vendor. Today Nataliya offers a wide variety of prices and merchandise. She has been in business for 12 years and has 5 hired employees. Currently, she has about $16,000 in inventory. Her monthly income is about $2400.   

Nataliya would like to increase assorted merchandise in her second vending facility. She is hoping to continue working in this sphere of trade and generate additional income. That is why she is requesting a loan of $1000. Nataliya’s business is the only source of income for her family. She is trying hard to earn enough to pay for her kids’ college education and finish the reconstruction of her private house. We believe timely financial assistance will keep Nataliya’s business stable and her family well provided for.

loans.use: Increase assorted goods

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Her parents' low economic resources did not permit her to continue her studies, Lucia now 26 years old. She is originally from the province of Azangaro, and her desire to improve herslef and offer support for the wellbeing of her family inspired her to move to the city of Juliaca. Since her arrival in the city she tasked herself and managed to open a small grocery store. She is now married and is mother to Nestor, a 9 year old boy. Lucia wants to increase the selection and stock quantities of her products. She believes that if she starts selling fruits and vegetables she will be filling her customers' demands and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Los bajos recursos económicos de sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional a la señora Lucia de 26 años de edad, ella es natural de la provincia de Azángaro, sus ganas de superarse y ofrecerle bienestar a su familia la llevaron a radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca.Desde que llegó a esta ciudad se dispuso a abrir e implementar su pequeña bodeguita de abarrotes, actualmente ya está casada y es madre de Néstor, niño de 9 años de edad.Lucia tiene pensado aumentar la variedad y el stock de su mercadería, ella cree que vendiendo verduras y frutas complacerá satisfactoriamente la demanda de sus clientes y además acrecentará sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: To invest her more capital to increase the quantity and selection of her products.

loans.name: Wiñay Waras Group

texts.es:
The Wiñay Waras Association is more than 12 years old, in the center of Alto Lima and one of the most responsible and punctual with regard to payments and the success of its businesses. It is made up primarily of women who most definitely collaborate with each other in the areas of responsibility and timeliness, in particular the younger members who make up the association. This group is characterized by commercial endeavors, primarily involving basic necessities and in some cases the ladies have their own place of business. This does not stop them, however, from also marketing their products at the fairs and markets. Currently, the Wiñay Waras Association requires capital to strengthen the business and to be ready for the various fairs in the cities of El Alto and La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Asociación Wiñay Waras es una asociación con una antigüedad de más de 12 años aproximadamente dentro del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, una de las más responsables y puntuales en referencia al pago de cuotas y a la prosperidad de sus negocios. Esta conformada en gran parte por mujeres que definitivamente colaboran en aspectos de responsabilidad y puntualidad principalmente a aquellas socias jóvenes que integran la Asociación. Esta asociación se caracteriza por el comercio de mercadería, principalmente artículos de primera necesidad, como ser víveres y en algunos casos las señoras son dueñas de tiendas de abarrotes, o simplemente venta de víveres al crédito. La mayoría no cuenta con puestos de venta propio, pero eso no impide que realicen su trabajo en ferias y mercados. Actualmente la asociación Wiñay Waras precisa de capital para fortalecer sus negocios, preparándolos para las distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y La Paz.

loans.use: Require capital to strengthen their businesses.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha's perseverance and effort have served her well, so she can continue staying in control of her house through her separation from her husband. She confronted this great challenge by opening a store in which she offers bread, which has brought her successful results for her household finances. Thanks to the good location of her store, her portfolio of customers has increased, and she hopes to increase her working capital to attend to each one of the orders of her neighbors and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Su constancia y esfuerzo le han servido a Martha, para continuar llevdo las riendas de su hogar tras la separación de su esposo. Afrontó este gran reto abriendo una tienda en el que oferta productos de pan llevar que le ha traído resultados exitosos en bien de su economía familiar.Gracias a la buena ubicación de su tiendita la cartera de sus clientes va en aumento y desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para atender cada una de las solicitudes de sus vecinos y amigos.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer a larger quantity of products.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal B. is a 21 year old farmer who continued in his father’s business of selling milk and yoghurt to the local people. In addition to helping his father from childhood, he gained real experience in 2005, when his father become sick and he had to run the business.  Vusal lives with his parents, who receive a  pension from the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Persons Settlement.  Vusal would like to purchase a cow to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the communal bank “Las Divinas”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 55 years old and has five children, however her income was not enough to meet their household expenses. It’s for this reason that Maria, with her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a sewing business.

Currently, she has a small business as a seamstress and making women’s clothing for which she rises at 7 am to make breakfast for her children, and from there she dedicates herself to making her garments until the late hours of the night to fill orders from customers.

With this loan of S/. 1,800, to be repaid over a six month period, she bought a sewing machine, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.

Maria wishes to increase her earnings so she can maintain her children who are her reason for wanting to get ahead. She asks to continue to be supported, and is very glad for the help that Manuela Ramos has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en la Av José Faustino Sánchez Carrión Mz A Lt 18, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años y es madre de 5 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan, es así que Maria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de costura. En la actualidad ella cuenta un pequeño negocio de servicio de costura y confección de prendas de vestir para damas, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, de allí se dedica a la confección de sus prendas hasta altas horas de la noche para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro 1 maquina de cocer, hilos, elásticos, botones, etc. Maria desea que sus ganancias aumenten para poder apoyar a sus hijos, que son su razón de ser para salir adelante, pide que le sigan a poyando y se siente muy feliz con el apoyo que le otorga Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine, thread, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Gumercinda C..  I work selling and producing tortillas.  For more than 20 years, I’ve been doing this same job.  Thanks to my business, I’ve enabled my children to get ahead and have also been building my house little by little.  At this time I need to pour the floor of my kitchen because right now the floor has no bricks.  This is something I desire to do in order to improve my quality of life.  I hope to have help from you.  Thank you.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer. 



hola mi nombre es Gumercinda C., me dedico a la venta y produccion de tortillas, tengo mas de 20 años de estar en esta misma actividad, gracias a mi negocio he logrado sacar a mis hijos adelante y tambien ir construyendo mi casa poco a poco, en estos momentos necesito fundir el piso de mi cocina ya que el piso en este momento no tiene ladrillos.
esto lo deseo para mejorar mi calidad de vida, espero tener una ayuda de ustedes.
gracias.

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, lime and bricks for a kitchen floor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr: At the borrower's request, this information has been removed.

loans.use: to buy a taxi motor

loans.name: Alisafa

texts.en:
Alisafa K. is 40 years old, married with four adorable children. His wife is a homemaker.

Alisafa has had his own business for 13 years. He started as the seller of clothing and gradually he has been becoming more involved in this business and dreaming to open his own trading place. Now he sells men's suits, coats, trousers and shirts in the central local market. Alisafa is a friendly and polite man. He is trying to diversify the range of goods to satisfy the needs of the clients with the various levels of income.

The business is stable, allowing Alisafa to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. His children are growing up and their expenses are increasing. Thus he wants to develop his business. For this purpose, he has applied for $US1200 for purchasing new modern suits and shirts. Alisafa thanks all for supporting him and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To  purchase new modern suits and shirts for selling.

loans.name: Phoeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeng S. is a villager in Boeng Tranh village in Takeo Province. She is 44-years-old, and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. She owns a small plot of land where she cultivates rice, and she also breeds pigs. Her husband, Mr. Kov Seng, sells hens and is featured to her right in the photo.

Even though Mrs. Phoeng S. and her husband have multiple businesses, they still do not earn enough money to support their needs. Thus Mrs. Phoeng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and piglets to grow her breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy pig food and piglets to improve her breeding business.

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San L. is a villager in Trouy Treoung Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Nol Nan, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. They have two children who are both construction workers. Although these family members have jobs, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve this, Mrs. San L. decided to ask for a loan to buy pillars for her house. She hopes to improve her house for her family.

loans.use: To buy pillars for her house.

loans.name: Bulenga B4-Ssekiwuka Sarah Group

texts.en:
Sarah S., 26 and married with two children aged four and two, has operated a retail grocery shop out of her home in Bulenga for the past three years. This business, which earns a weekly profit of over $20, came into existence through the support of her husband, who runs an electrical shop.

Sarah is now requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, flours and rice to meet the demands of her customers. Her major dreams are to open up a pharmacy in the city centre and send her children to the best schools in the country.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, flours and rice.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y poder. 
Carolina es de Apurimac, conviviente tiene 30 años,  cinco hijos de 14, 12, 10, 7,  estudian en el colegio de San Juan y el de 3 años va al nido.

Empezó en el negocio de comida vendiendo papa rellena por ocho años seguidos  en la Ciudad, con la ayuda de su esposo llegaron a tener tres carretas, cada día se levantaba muy temprano para preparar las papa rellena, no dándole  tiempo para atender a sus hijos,  pero el vender papa rellena cada vez se le fue haciendo mas pesado y muy trabajoso, ella seguía teniendo mas hijos por que no se cuidaba, se le hacia mas difícil trabajar y atender a sus hijos, su esposo consiguió trabajo en una construcción, ella  decidió cambiar  a la venta de salchi-papas, actualmente  sale a vender  de lunes a viernes  de 5pm hasta las 9:30 pm,  los sábado trabaja limpiando casas, y por las tardes atiende a sus hijos.

Con Finca su negocio cambio he aprendido ahorrar, ha comprar al por mayor para ganar mas, no le gusta que le descuenten cuando otros no pagan pero ella sabe que esas son las reglas del Bancomunal.
Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles  para la compra de aceite,  comprar saco de papas e ingredientes  para la preparación de salchi-papas.
Carolina sueña con terminar de construir su casa y poner una tienda de abarrotes, ella se ha puesto una meta que dentro de dos años va ha lograrlo, tiene que trabajar duro pero lo hará con la ayuda de su familia.
texts.en:
Carolina is a member of the "Force and Power" Village Bank. Carolina is from Apurimac, cohabitant, 30 years old and has five children with ages of 14, 12, 10, and 7 that study at San Juan School and a 3 year old that attends nursery school. Carolina started her business selling "papa rellana" (stuffed potatoes) eight years ago in the city and with the help of her spouse now has three street carts. Each day she rises very early to prepare the stuffed potatoes, which leaves her little time to attend to her children as the preparation is more work over time. Since she kept having more children and it become difficult to care for them and work, her husband found a job in construction and she decided to change and sell "salchi-papas" (a fried sausage and potatoe snack) which she sells from Monday to Friday from 5pm until 9:30pm and Saturdays she works cleaning houses, while attending to her children in the afternoon. With FINCA Carolina's business has changed and she has learned to save. She buys ingredients wholesale so that she can earn more. She does not like to pay if other members lack resources, but she knows the rules of the village bank. She needs an 800 soles loan to buy oil and potatoes as ingredients for the preparation of the salchi-papas. Carolina dreams of finishing the construction of her home and putting in a small grocery store. She has made a goal to achieve this in two years and with the help of her family and hard work, hopes to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil and potatoes as indgredients

loans.name: Tith

texts.en: Mr. Tith K. lives in the Thlos village in Takeo province. He is 59 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is employed in electric factory while the other is enrolled in the local school. He is a construction worker who has a little salary. His wife, Mrs. Oun Kouch, is a farmer who owns 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Tith K. needs a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.  His wife is pictured with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Maqbool M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Maqbool baji is a 46-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Maqbool baji is married to a man whose name is M. A. and he is a driver, driving a local 32-seat bus. Maqbool baji is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. Her elder son drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The younger is a bus conductor. Her daughters are getting an education from a local school. Maqbool baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her elder son.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Sajida baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rukhsana Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. Ghafooran baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Minana

texts.en: Minana Y. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Minana buys fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sells them at the market. Her business, which she has run since 2004, is located at the Elmina sea shore. Her husband is a fisherman. Minana uses her income to assist her husband with house keeping expenses. Minana will use the loan to increase her capital in order to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Minana plans to save towards buying a house, which she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice S. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two of whom are currently in school; one in senior high and the other in junior high schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Aquase, a fishing community near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Beatrice is a trader. She trades in second-hand textiles, including clothing for both men and women. She also sells bedsheets and other textile materials. She says she hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell her goods and treks to other markets to sell. Beatrice also sometimes sells at the market square in her community. Beatrice buys bales of textiles from wholesalers in the nearby towns.

She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Arlyn T., 48 years old, is married and lives at Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a carpenter and they are lucky to have one child. Her husband's income does not suffice for all their needs in their daily living and that is why, with her small store, Arlyn helped with added income.

To be able to buy additional commodities for the store, Mrs. T. applies to Paglaum for a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900. She is praying for the success of her store so that she will give all the best of life to her child, who is a student.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
